Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with kids”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to find a room large enough for a family of four that is reasonably priced in Venice. We had a wonderful family loft room, with a sitting area, two small bathrooms and funky (in a good way) fold down bunk beds for our kids. We loved it. Great staff, delicious breakfast with a wide selection of choices. Hotel is very easy to find, only a short walk from the waterbus stop. All important when traveling with children! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laleh B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the location was great.the staff were kind and friendly.the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Bisanzio in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TonyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Totally recommend this hotel. Ideal location - one minute from the waterfront and San Marco Zaccharia waterbus stop, so easy to walk to many of the sights or travel further on the canals/in the lagoon. Reception staff friendly and helpful; we arrived early to drop cases but were allowed straight to our room. It was a superior with balcony, well worth the extra. Very spacious and comfortable; enormous en suite and balcony with rooftop views. Breakfast, with hot and cold buffet, very substantial, if a little ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Elkins”
Reviews.Author: JanElkins
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful and nothing is too much bother for them. Room very clean and pleasant decor. Perfect location and easy access to water Bus. Free kettle and tea and coffee in room if you ask .All in all they made our visit to Venice very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: harters
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the major sites with St Marks being not much more than 5 minutes walk away. And, if youâ€™d caught the ferry from the airport, itâ€™d be literally only a couple of minutes from the stop (although weâ€™d thrown some money at the transfer and pre-booked a water taxi). Front desk staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. And it was a pleasant surprise to be upgraded to a â€œsuperiorâ€� room because all the basics were taken â€“ if possible, they will do this in similar circumstances for customers who have booked direct, rather than those using a booking agent. Breakfast is OK, with the usual â€œcontinentalâ€� offering of pastries, cold meats and cheese, along with scrambled egg and unpleasantly undercooked bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location,wonderful staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sorush
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Venice where we stayed 3 nights in Best Western Bisanzio hotel, I chose the hotel according to good reviews in Tripadvisor, and I am really happy with my choice. The hotel is located in frount of the San Zaccharia station were you will get off the airport line blue from venice airport or line one from the train station. It is a short walk to San Marco square and you can reach all venice on foot or you can use the public transport to see the lovely city of Venice. The staff is specially friendly and helped us with all our requests such an planning a taxi tour to Murano , showing us nice restaurants, etc. The rooms are clean and specially the rooms with a terrace are quite large for a Venician hotel. Free WiFi Internet is available in the entire hotel and you can get 24 hour pass from the frount desk. Theybare always there for you with a smile. The breakfast served in the ground floor is a good start for a day and is of good quality and taste, besides, the coffee and milk served there is the most delicious in the city . Tip for tourists: tap water in Venice is drinkable and tasty and as I searched in internet is the best in Italy, so don't waste your money buying mineral water. There are also many drinkable water taps in the city Tip for those traveling to Venice by plane: get a two way ticket from and to the airport from the tourist guide desk in the aririvals hall for 25â‚¬ and you will save 5 euros. Take blue line and get of the boat at San Zaccaria station, then turn right, cross one bridge, you reach a church and there yiu are at the end of the alley is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better choices”
Reviews.Author: rnich
Reviews.Content: Was suppose to spend 2 nights here but only managed one as the room we were given smelled musty, like wet cement, the sheets on our bed had a rather large hole in them, there were ants crawling up the side of the tub in the bathroom. Could not sleep at all as the matress was hard as a rock, the pillow so flat that you might as well have had none. The smell also got to me and made it hard to breath. For a Best Western this was a huge disappointment. Due to all this we checked out the next day and stayed at a modern hotel on Mestre which by the way was 5 star and cheaper to boot. What a disappointment.!

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Harrierstours
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at this hotel from 23rd March 2012 with my wife Breakfast was nice with a good choice of either hot or cold Room was very comfortable, but because of the hotels position (down a narrow alleyway) the view was of an adjacent building.This is normal for the majority of hotels in Venice. The hotel is 1 minute from grande canal and a 5 minute walk from St Marks's The staff couldnt have been more helpful-

Reviews.Title: “Great Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: LeeAuburn
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel with a family of 4. At arrival, Gabrielle at front desk was extremely cordial and helpful. He sold us on the hotel with his attentiveness and respectfulness as we worked through some minor changes. The Hotel is very clean and centrally located for a great Venice experience. Highly Recommend for the value alone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: LeanneM2012
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 3 nights here at the start of our honeymoon. The location was convenient however our room was super tiny hardly fit our 2 suitcases, left no floor space to walk. Also agree with other reviewers mosquitos a problem. Breakfast was nice. Reception service was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: sharon r
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights staying at this small hotel which is within walking distance of St marks - lovely clean rooms were quite basic but nicely decorated and perfectly adequate - we were lucky enough to have a balcony which we used in the evening although mosquitos were a bit of a problem but it didnt spoil our stay. The hotel staff on reception, at breakfast and the chamber maids were all lovely and nothing was too much trouble. There is a comfortable lounge and a small bar. The breakfast was varied and kept us going for a while - have no doubt that we would definately stay here again if we ever came back to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: nikki_purcell84
Reviews.Content: Staff exceptionally helpful, especially breakfast ladies and maids. Food very nice and very good location close to transport and st marks. We has a great room with balcony however when door left open mozzies attacked us therefore had to sleep with all windows and doors closed.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: BillPillenger
Reviews.Content: Very well kept hotel throughout with a welcoming reception, comfortable sitting room and bar area. Our room at the 6th floor was a very good size, well decorated, comfortable and clean with nice bathroom. Staff very helpful. Breakfast included in price and decent. I don't think I will look anywhere esle the next time I visit Venice. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A venetian gem”
Reviews.Author: sliderTelaviv
Reviews.Content: Best western Bisanzio in Venice is quiet gem, that it's location and venetian dÃ©cor makes it a superb hotel for a short or long visit In Venice. The hotel is located in a small ally right beside the main promenade 5 min for the main vaporetto (water buses) stations and San Marco Sq. the shortest walk leads you to the famous wailing bridge , plazzo ducelle, St marks basilica, and from there the other sites like the Rialto Br, and the Accademia museum are minutes away. The rooms are clean and filled with venetian dÃ©cor , like chandeliers , wooden sofas and marble coffee tables. The rooms are quiet and very romantic , my view was of a small sq. the rooms are very quiet and have flat screen TV's . The staff are very friendly and helpful and give you advices on dinning and directions to the major sites and even helped me earn some miles at my frequent flyers club (with filling forms and explaining the procedures) I recommend this hotel very much , and will book this hotel next time in Venice!!! I thank a lot of reviewers that recommended this hotel , it made my stay great! Some Tips: 1) the hotel Vaporetto staion is San Marco- San Zaccaria. And the 1, 2, N (night line) and the airport shuttle service ( Alilaguna blue line ) stop there. 2) the hotel is very easy to find, walk on Riva di Schivoni (the main promenade) right from the Vaporetto stations, and after 2 bridges you see a big church , right after it you turn left to Calle di piete and the hotel is at the end of the ally! 3) it's easy to get to the city and the hotel via the shuttle service ( a water bus ) that operates till after midnight . the terminal is outside from the main terminal at the airport and it takes a short walk from the terminal . it costs 16 euros (round trip 26) , and you can buy tickets on the boat itself. It takes about an hour from the airport to San Zaccaria (it's the sixth staion) 4) Venice and the hotel awaits you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous alternative to the overpriced”
Reviews.Author: baef47
Reviews.Content: 24 years ago we stayed at the Bisanzio while on our honeymoon. Back then we had felt let down by the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal (service, room size, cleanliness) and after a bad night we stumbled upon the Bisanzio just on the other side of St Mark's Square as an alternative. Our memories of the liberating unpretentious service offered by the Hotel Bisanzio have remained with us since. On this occasion we found the same culture of welcoming and polite service from booking to checkout and everything in-between. We had two wonderful rooms and one even had the balcony and view as per the photo on the the hotels website. The rooms were extremely quite (helpful when getting over jet lag). So quite - that not even the bells of Venice intruded - not that I mind bells. The rooms were also very fresh, clean and relatively spacious. The breakfasts (part of our package) were OK. We had some wonderful restaurant recomendations from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen351
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel is fantastic, close to vaporetto stop. Few minutes walk to st Marks Square. Staff make you feel very welcome. Rooms very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: AngusMcK2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as an anniversary trip for my wife. It was our forth time in Venice and definitely the best hotel yet. The location is truly perfect- so near the waterfront and just 100m from the nearest vaporetto stop. Also less than 5 minutes to St Marks Square. Above everything, the staff are lovely, great English and very hospitable. The room was spacious, very clean, warm and quiet. The tub was deep-perfect for a soak after lots of walking. Breakfast is a simple buffet with fresh espresso (illy-shame not Kimbo!) so really nice start to the day. For a trip/ special occasion you will get great value here and superb welcome- I highly recommend it. If you want tea/coffee in room you must ask-it will be supplied- we were happy with the mini bar!

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Giuzeppe
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights with my wife and another couple. We had 2 rooms next to each other at the 6th floor, both rooms with balcony as we had requested. Rooms very good size, well decorated, comfortable and clean with nice bathroom. Hotel very well kept throughout with a welcoming reception area, comfortable lounge and bar. Staff very helpful. Breakfast included in price and decent. My only little negative is the mattress which I found too flat though it didn't bother my wife. Incidentally my friend in the other room commented the same about their mattress. I don't think I would look anywhere else the next time I visit Venice.The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Dije101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, using air miles towards some of the stay. We had a kind and caring welcome, the staff were relaxed and helpful and spoke excellent English. We had tea making facilities provided for our rooms free of charge. Space in Venice is at a premium and the rooms were not enormous but more than adequate and clean; The bathrooms were well appointed. Breakfast was a very good buffet, hot and cold - it was not the huge buffet that Americans might expect, though! No restaurant but plenty of places to eat within two minutes' walk. The water bus and St Mark's Square are literally a few minutes away .The hotel is up a narrow walkway a few yards from the water, where gondolas wallow gently on the wake of passing boats. Towards the Arsenal is a wide street where you will find a cheap supermarket where water is 46 cents for a one and a half litre bottle - it's really expensive elsewhere.The cheapest half litre water we found in the centre was in a machine at the entrance to the bell tower at 1 euro. (you can go in that area without paying) Suggest you buy your tickets for the vaporetto and other transport on line before leaving and exchange your voucher when at the airport. Toilets at the Ferrovia (train station) costly but clean and convenient if you're walking the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Hotel 10 minutes from St.Marco Piazza”
Reviews.Author: eyelevel
Reviews.Content: My wife and l enjoyed a lovely 3 night break at the Bisanzio Hotel from 7th November 2011. On arrival we were greeted by Toni a lovely man and very helpful , our room wasn't in the main Hotel , but in one of there Apartments just round the corner from front entrance we had Room 114 , the room was large , clean , well decorated , sadly we didn't sleep to well due to a fan sound from bathroom area , but not from our room. Next morning we saw Toni , explained the problem and he gave us another room No.112 just down the hall , well this room was amazing , lounge , bathroom downstairs , then staircase to the loft bedroom , just stunning ( see photos ) The breakfast as many have said is not the best but certainly not the worst we have had in Italy , there is plenty of choice but sadly no fresh fruit salad , fresh whole fruit was available , along with tradional continental fare & cereals, yogurt etc. Gabriele was another gentleman at reception who was very helpful and always very polite he help us with info on the church at the corner of the street leading to the Hotel which had a plaque regarding Antonio Vivaldi , Gabrriele told us about the history and that the church was designed for Vivaldi's music concerts in mind , it has limited opening times but well worth a look. The Hotel is very close to Vaporato stops and is less than 10 minutes walk to St. Marco Piazza. The Hotel is very quite which is nice after a busy day walking around Venice. WiFi is available for 5 euro for 24 hours in the lounge / bar area. Overall we had a most enjoyable stay and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tifosi08
Reviews.Content: A small but comfortable hotel, close to San Marco but very quiet in a secluded alleyway just off the Riva degli Schiavoni, the main waterfront. Staff are polite, pleasant, and helpful. Rooms are small and modestly furnished, but spotlessly clean and comfortable. Servicing of rooms is very thorough and efficient. The greatest advantage of the hotel is its location ... just a short walk to San Marco ... just 20 yards to the waterfront .. but very quiet. The only criticism is the poor quality of the buffet breakfast..... poor quality meusli, hard unpalatable bread, and rather poor choice. Also staff seem incapable of serving hot coffee .. despite complaints, warm is the best they can manage. After three mornings we gave up and did without. Shame as otherwise it is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well run, very helpfull, and in a quiet area near The San Marco cathedral.”
Reviews.Author: FZappa
Reviews.Content: This is a very well run, family owned hotel that is just a short distance east from central Marco Piazza down a small quiet alley. We stayed in one of the loft apartments that they have for families - two bunk beds for children and a separate queen sized bed for the adults. There were two bathrooms. All was clean and well kept. A good hot breakfast was provided with the room. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM”
Reviews.Author: TrueUK
Reviews.Content: Recommended to us on its position ( although would we normally aim for 4 star ) this hotel was just perfect . Arrived in the dark yet hotel easy to find , had been upgraded and room was lovely - 6th floor with balcony . What a great start to our break . The breakfast was more than adequate and all the staff were welcoming . With all the sites to see and restauarants to sample there really was no point in staying somewhere that offered facilities that would not be used . Would certainly recommend and go back .

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: GadaboutSolihull
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the ground floor, (109) with a lovely window opening onto a courtyard. It wasn't a huge room, but it was very pleasant, with attractive furnishings. The beds were absolutely fine, (no duvets though - blankets) but, unfortunately, the pillows were very flat and hard - really very uncomfortable. If these had been softer then I would have had no complaints whatsoever about this hotel. Its location is ideal; it is clean and attractive, and the staff are extremely helpful. Towels were changed every day; breakfast was adequate (could have been more choices, but I am not complaining). The room was quiet - we had no problems whatsoever with noise disturbance. It is possible that the AirCon was not working, although we didn't need it. It was lovely just to enjoy the open window, and there were no mosquitoes, this being the end of October. The location was perfect for our purposes - visiting the Biennale, sightseeing, etc. The water taxi takes you from the airport to a spot only a short walk from the hotel; a return ticket cost 25 Euros. Allow plenty of time though for your return trip - it takes perhaps one and a half hours - though it is simple and not at all stressful, provided you leave in good time. These Alilaguna boats leave for the airport at 25 past and 5 to the hour, and the ticket office people are very helpful in telling you which stop to use - it's about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We had to pay an extra 6 Euros each per night in the Hotel tax that they have started to levy: this was more than we thought it was. Just to add: if you like a cup of tea, take your travel kettle! Overall, the Bisanzio is a very satisfactory hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Coastalexplorers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for it's proximity to St Mark's square. It really is in a fab position. The hotel staff were immediately very friendly and gave us lots of information. They gave us a fantastic restaurant recommendation which was a highlight of our stay. The room was spacious and we had a lovely balcony. The only let down of the Hotel for us was the breakfast. It was fine the first day, but with a limited choice it became monotonous after a couple of days. Overall though we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: minnego6
Reviews.Content: Venice is one of the most beautiful and romantic cities in Italy. Taking the vaporetto from the train station down the Grand Canal is a beautiful ride. But unless you hired a watertaxi, getting yourself and your luggage to any hotel can be exhausting. The canal streets around San Marco are packed with tourists and vendors, and I think most travel agents or individuals booking their own hotel seem to book those hotels in closest proximity to San Marco. However, getting away from the crowds of Venice is much more relaxing and gives you a better feeling of what Venetians living here enjoy. I have stayed at the Hotel Bisanzio twice and both times I enjoyed the location so much, I wanted to come back. The last stop on the Vaporetto is San Zaccaria, Exit to the right on Riva Degli Schiavoni and cross over one of the canal bridges and take the first left at Calle del Pieta. Down at the end of the quiet street is the Hotel Bisanzio. Most of the hotel prices in Venice are higher than other cities in Italy, but Bisanzio serves a full-breakfast, unlike many. There rooms vary from very modest to more elegant. The rooms are not large, but the hotel is very intimate and the staff friendly. I loved the location because you did not have to compete to get on vaporetto at the busiest stop at San Marco. From this location you can go to San Giorgo or any other stops going down the Grand Canal and you might even get a good seat to enjoy the ride verses standing. Another benefit is that the hotel is close to some restaurants that are not as busy in the evening because they are away from the main tourist attractions. When the cruise ship traffic leaves for the day, you will find that many of the streets of Venice are deserted. Although the streets are dark, Venice is very safe to walk around in the evening and enjoy sea breeze or the sunset. The hotel is more than happy to arrange a watertaxi which will pick you up at the back door of the hotel and take you to the airport or the train station when you leave. If you like the crowds and the noise of Piazza San Marco, then the Bisanzio is not for you. But if you want a quiet enjoyable hotel stay with a great location and friendly staff, then this is where I would recommend you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bisanzio, Venice, Italy.”
Reviews.Author: GILLYDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good position near to St. Mark's Square and therefore close to the centre of Venice. The service is excellent, particularly the room service, the hotel spotless and the breakfast menu good, although somewhat limited. The ammenities are as to be expected from a Best Western hotel, being to a good, general standard. The location of the hotel, being off the main harbour front, means that it enjoys a position away from the bustle of the crowds although some noise can be experienced from passing pedestrians but, in fairness, this aspect applies to most of the hotel accomodation in Venice.The staff are extremely efficient and helpful. One word of warning; do not accept the 'free' water-taxi service, to Murano, laid on by the hotel, unless you are prepared to accept the invitation to visit the glass factory which awaits you on your arrival.You are expected to purchase items from the factory as part of the deal.This, in hindsight was a mistake, since the 'arrangement' was not made clear to us and resulted in an angry reception from the hotel staff on our return, leaving us feeling embarrassed and annoyed at the misunderstanding which somewhat dampered our , otherwise, enjoyable day. We would certainly wish to return to this hotel if we again visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “nice for short trip”
Reviews.Author: manimatter
Reviews.Content: I am a longtime traveller to Venice. Always short stays. This time by car. So we arrived at car parking Tronchetto (one of the cheapest) and in about 20 minutes travelled to Piazza San Marco/Zaccaria by vaporetto. The hotel is very close and you don't have to carry your luggage all the way narrow paths through Venice - what could really be a pain in the xxx. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room quite comfortable, but not venetian oldschool like. Breakfast as usual in Italy for a three star. The best: You can easily get to the Biennale sites.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Guitarzilla74
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, just a few hundred meters from St Marks Square. Nice staff, room lovely for the price. Couldn't find much fault at all with this hotel. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Read before you book”
Reviews.Author: Travel4JoyNYC
Reviews.Content: Sept. 17, 2011 Great Rooms, Great service, Best Guest Service we had in all of Italy, Beds nice. No complaints here, great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel for 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: BikerChick99
Reviews.Content: We were only in Venice one night. This hotel was a pleasant surprise, very professional, dignified staff, we were treated like royalty. Nice decor, great location, very close to St. Mark's square. Bathroom fixtures were all new, good size shower bath, but they need convex shower curtain rods. I believe all Italian beds are hard, but have to say, this one was particularly hard. Internet was 5 Euro/daily - we didn't use it. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tony H
Reviews.Content: We went with two friends to Bisanzio. Rooms were v clean and attractive, breakfast v good and staff v friendly and helpful. Would certainly recommend it to others. Location is good just off the Grand Canal. Found Venice wonderful place - Doges Palace, Accademia ,Bassilica and the islands of Murano, Burano and Torcello were absolutely fantastic to see. Venice is expensive compared to UK which we accepted but we did experience a big rip off at Levana cafe ( yellow seats opposite Campanile , St Marcs Square) . Sat down on seats outside and ordered a Sprite and fresh orange. Not that many people sitting at the tables and we realised why when we got the bill -- 29.70 euros!!!!!! Sprite was 8.50, fresh orange 9.80 and supplement for music was 11.40 !! We noticed a group of 4 musicians playing at the front but no mention made of any charge. Beware of this rip off.

Reviews.Title: “More space than most hotel rooms in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Brisbanefirstimer
Reviews.Content: We booked an "apartment" It had a small fridge but no cooking facilities. The hotel is in a great position and one of my favourite areas in Venice. The apartment was just around the corner from the hotel. Apparently there are apartments associated with the hotel that have cooking facilities. The staff were very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, enjoyable visit!”
Reviews.Author: Jerald L
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here at the end of our trip to Venice. We were in one of the loft suites, just around the corner from the main hotel - a lovely room with very comfy beds, even the ones pulled down from the wall for the children, and luxury of 2 shower rooms and toilets. Decor really nice too and staff all very helpful, friendly and professional. We would definitely love to come back here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ptgrrtt
Reviews.Content: I will definitely be back! This hotel is in a little alleyway close to St Marks Square and opposite a vaporetti stop. It's a lovely hotel and I had a spacious room with a good sized bathroom, a very comfortable bed and the location is brilliant. I really enjoyed the breakfast and the staff were very helpful - delicious coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: Spluga
Reviews.Content: We returned to Bisanzio for the second year in succession and wish to complement the consistant standard of service we received. Friendly, multiligual and knowlegeable reception staff. Well kept clean rooms. Wonderful breakfast. Great location for vapoetto access.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Spacious Loft Suite”
Reviews.Author: Cecille C
Reviews.Content: While we did not appreciate the ONE bridge we had to cross with our luggages from the San Zaccaria stop, we enjoyed the location and our stay! Our Loft Suite was situated in another building just around the corner. You used your card key to enter the building and again to enter your room. Our suite on the ground floor consisted of 2 bunk beds (which had our 2 daughters, 6 and 11 y/o, beyond thrilled!), a living room with an armoire, 2 bathrooms and one could request for a tea/coffee service and iron/board, which was promptly brought to us. The breakfast was good w/ great coffee and hot chocolate. The waitress did give my husband a surprised, playful look when he ordered hot chocolate instead of coffee.. :)). The breakfast staff was friendly. We heard about the staff imposing the Murano trip on guests but we were not even offered that option until my husband inquired about it the next afternoon and by then, we had already decided that there was enough to do in Venice without going to Murano. We were spoiled by the location - so near to tourist sites and across, you find the Grand Canal. The only negative for me was that Internet was not available in our building and had to go to the hotel lobby to access. We would recommend this hotel to families and will stay here again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CLG74
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is only a few metres from the grand canal, and very close to Palazzo Ducale, Piazzo San Marco and Basilica San Marco. The area is nice, and there are some good bars and restaurants nearby. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Breakfast is a little basic but ok. We would definitely go back if we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanLuvr
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Bisanzio in June. The front desk staff were incredible. Very helpful regarding restaurants, touring, suggestions, etc. They knew which rooms we were in every time we walked in the door and had our keys ready. The hotel was spotless. They arranged a water taxi ride to Murano (for free - had to pay for the vaporetto back to San Zaccaria). They also printed our boarding passes for us. Basically they did whatever it took to make our stay enjoyable. The rooms were very nice. We had two balcony rooms and one of them was big enough for 4 of us to sit and drink a bottle of wine before dinner. Free breakfast was a plus. Eggs, yogurt, juice, toast, croissants. very nice. The only downside was that the beds were hard.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but...”
Reviews.Author: lalassie
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Venice and our second stay at the Hotel Bisanzio. It's very convenient if you don't mind crossing TWO bridges with your luggage from the Vaporetto stop to get to the hotel (only one to return to the train station). The location is great -- just down a small street from Riva degli Schiavoni and the vaporetto lines and a short distance to Piazza San Marco. The vaporetto stop for Lido, Murano, Burano is right out front of the small street. Real neighborhoods are around the corner so you have your choice of tourist or not. The downside -- based on our other Italian hotels including Rome, this was quite expensive for what it offered. The room was okay as was the breakfast. Nothing to write home about for sure. Additionally, the staff wanted to direct us to certain restaurants and Murano field trips and I would be very surprised if there was no kickback involved. We ate at one of the "recommended" ones on our previous stay and it was overpriced and super touristy (but edible). I would recommend it with the caveat that you're paying for location with no views. Internet, of course, has a charge. Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Experience”
Reviews.Author: AngelaandTom
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more satisfied with our choice of this hotel which provided excellent accommodation in an ideal position. It is located a mere five minute walk from the bustling St Mark's Square and only 100 metres from the lagoon waterfront. An early walk before breakfast when these areas are fresh and free from crowds is highly recommended. The water bus transport is also only about two minutes away, so it a very short distance to walk with luggage upon arrival from or departure to the airport. Despite being near one of Venice's main centres of attraction, the hotel is situated along a narrow, relatively quiet passageway. Our room overlooked a courtyard and we heard no external sounds whatsoever. (Although we cannot comment on other rooms). All members of staff were friendly, informative, helpful and extremely courteous. Our room was spotlessly clean and equally immaculate when we returned each day. The bathroom had modern fittings with an over-bath shower and unlimited hot water. Shampoo / shower wash, soap and tissues were provided and replenished as necessary. There was plenty of lighting, provided by chandelier lights and bedside lamps in the bedroom. Together with the classic style furniture, the room had an attractive appearance. Effective air conditioning made this a comfortable retreat, both day and night. A fridge provided a good selection of soft and alcoholic drinks. There was an excellent selection at breakfast, served from 7:15am for those wishing to make an early start. This included a good supply of hot and cold drinks, cereal, a variety of meats, cheese and various spreads and yogurts. Also, a self service heated container provided eggs and bacon. There were several different breads, including a delicious sweet variety with almonds and, occasionally, apple cake. A bread toaster was also available. All in all, a perfect base for exploring this wonderful and enchanting city. Tips A 40 minutes gondola trip costs 80 Euros. If you just want the chance to experience a gondola ride and don't mind the fact the it only lasts 5 minutes, take a trip across the Grand Canal at one or more of several ferry (trahgetto) points at a cost of only 50 cents per person. Food and drinks are very expensive and plenty of re-hydration is needed in the heat. Recycle your plastic water bottle by refilling it at the drinking fountains to be found in many squares. If you want to escape crowds in the main tourist areas, you will need a need a good map to be able to negotiate the maze of alleyways. You will be well rewarded when you come across all manner of delights on the way which might otherwise be missed and you will have more opportunity of discovering the true Venice. We found the AA City Map and Mini-guide was invaluable, although not always completely accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Best so far”
Reviews.Author: Loren5475
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple had the pleasure of staying at Bisanzio 2010. It presents all the aspects we were looking for, easy access by water taxi from the airport, steps to the water and Saint Marks, very nice breakfast, large terraces some with great views and above all staff that go out of their way to be helpful. Get them to show you their personal pieces of Murano glass and where to find them. I write this in response to Maria G's scathing review. Everyone is entitle to their opinion and she obviously has myuch higher standards and expectations. But read the other reviews as well as mine, Stay here and you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: CBRH
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Bisanzio. For us, it's about the room . . . and so we stayed again in #503 which has a fairly large terrance looking to the bell tower and San Marco. They've done some updating since we were last there so it's even nicer. Wifi is available (add'l charge.) But it's the staff that's over the top. The owner (whose family has owned the building for decades) is right at the desk and the managers will make anything happen for you. We highly, highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Bleh.”
Reviews.Author: maria00715
Reviews.Content: The staff were unfriendly and arrogant, the breakfast looked like it was from a gas station, and the beds and pillows were very low comfort quality. Spend a little more and go somewhere good.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: FDS100
Reviews.Content: What a great location. Close enough to St Marks and far enough away to be quiet. We (2 families of 5) stayed in the apartments close by in 2 apartements. They were clean with good facilities. The upstairs apartment was very spacious with a balcony terrace on the roof. Beds were reasonably comfortable and all slept well. Kids room had low ceiling so watch your head. Breakfast was included in the main hotel down the street but this was not a problem and had plenty to choose from which is needed for children. Food stores are close by so you can find plenty of groceries for the apartment nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true.”
Reviews.Author: AnneM001
Reviews.Content: Perfection is said to be elusive-not at the Hotel Bisanzio in Venice. The staff was very courteous and professional. The establishment spotless and well maintained. We enjoyed the warm and welcome aura of the hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: india1939
Reviews.Content: Not only a great location, but a gem of a hotel with exceptionally friendly staff, great breakfast, good size rooms for a European hotel, sizeable modern bath and a cute little terrace to enjoy the breezes. Just off a main thorofare'it is quietly welcoming. A short stroll from the San Zaccharia vaporetto stop and St.Mark's Square, We can.'t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TG_James
Reviews.Content: Located near the San Marco. In a small alley. Easy to locate compared to the other hotel located inside the Venice Maze. Nice room. Nice breakfast Taxi Boat to Marco Polo Airport located right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service & good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ronbron
Reviews.Content: Venice was our 3rd hotel on our month long holiday to Italy/Paris. We used TA to rate this hotel and were a bit sceptical on the reviews. But the hotel was great - they upgraded us to a family room (2A / 2C) which was located in a building around the corner. It had a separate main bedroom and double bunk beds and was clean, comfortable and most importantly quiet. Location was relatively central with easy access to vaporetto just outside at canal and St Marco. Service at front desk and breakfast was efficient, friendly and helpful and we felt welcomed throughout our 4 night stay. Could improve internet access but just acceptable for a 3 star. Room had modern bathroom fixtures and didn't run out of hot water like other hotels we visited. Would certainly recommend this hotel and will stay there again - must return to beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wadokia
Reviews.Content: A great location, minutes from San Marco square, the main sites, restaurants, bars and boat stops. We were upgraded to a superior room which was spacious, very clean and well decorated. All the staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. The breakfast offered a range of options which were all very tasty and totally sufficient. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice and would defonately use it again should we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: dansbigworld
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend stay at the Hotel Bisanzio in Venice. The hotel is great and me and my partner had a lovely stay. Firstly the location is brilliant, just off the Grande Canal and literally a 2 minute walk (if that) to St Marks Square and all the other sites. The main Vaporetta stop is directly outside the hotel as are a variety of restaurants and other ammenities. All the staff we encountered at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and we both felt at home and comfortable in the hotel. Our room was lovely, just the right size for the two of us and we even had a small balcony over looking the rooftops of Venice. The only down side to the hotel was the breakfast, though it is your standard European fare - cereal, fruit, cold cuts and eggs and some pastry. We had it on our first morning but didn't bother after that (having a healthy Gelatto breakfast instead). All in all I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone travelling to venice. We had a lovely stay and the hotel was everything we could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: rosesniffer
Reviews.Content: The Bisanzio is in a good location for transport to/from the airport or to take a vaporetto to other areas of town. Very close to San Marco Piazza. The entrance is charming.....2/3 of the front desk staff is unbelievably arrogant....our room was spacious with a decent sized bath and a view of an inner courtyard. The bed was not comfortable..... The draperies and blankets needed a good cleaning. In-room safe was small but appreciated. The breakfast was typical for Italy. Everything was fresh and service by the energetic women that staff the breakfast room was great. I would stay there again, but I would like to see their draperies and blankets and bedcovers clean!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hotel Bisanzio!”
Reviews.Author: tinetravel87
Reviews.Content: Avoid Hotel Biszanzo at all costs! After perusing Tripadvisor.com and noticing their high rating, I booked a 2 night stay. After a grueling 7 hour journey, the first thing I realized after entering the room was that the comfort level of the bed was equivalent to a piece of plywood. The two pillows were as flat as pancakes and offered very little support. If you are a person with back problems, you may be running to the nearest pharmacy to buy pain killers. The hallway and the room itself were scorching hot and after turning on the air conditioning for a couple of hours, the air conditioning stopped working and started emitting heat instead. We were forced to open the windows and were then accosted by multiple mosquitoes that bit us throughout the night. I counted 14 mosquito bites the next day. There was a free daily breakfast that was free for good reason. It included cold cuts, cheese, eggs, and bacon. On the second day, the eggs were mostly gone and there was no bacon left. The food looked less appetizing than a McDonald's breakfast. When inquiring about a late check-out policy, the desk employee was extremely snarky, arrogant, and rude. He said "Well I don't know what YOU are used to, but we do not do that here." In past experiences, most highly rated hotels offer a late check-out option for an additional fee. We were told that we had to vacate the room by 11:00 am and since our flight was at 10:30 pm, we asked if it was possible to keep our room until 12:00 pm instead of 11:00 am. With a grimace and a smile, the receptionist said that this was not possible. When we asked about holding our luggage during the day, he assured us that our bags would be safe even though they would be completely in the open and available for anyone to steal. The bags were in an area that was not visible to him from the front desk and we were not at all reassured that our bags would be safe. After reading other guests' less than stellar reviews, a Hotel Biszanzo associate responded with the statement that the guest was not being objective nor was offering a balanced point of view. Not only was this hotel less than enjoyable, they were not willing to acknowledge their mistakes and apologize for the guests' displeasure. It was with great joy that we left Hotel Biszanzio and we never plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: El_Carlos1980
Reviews.Content: I booked here for my wife's surprise 30th birthday, and she loved the hotel, as did I. Our room was on the 5th floor, with some awesome views of the roof tops of Venice, as well as St Marks Basillica in the distance. Walking distance to St Marks, on the Alilaguna route and the ATVO waterbus stops to get around the rest of Venice. The room was great with the wood beams and sloped ceiling. A real traditional Venetian style room. The only downside was the bath with shower was under the slope so you couldn't actually stand under the shower, but hold the shower head instead. That's the only bad thing I can say. The breakfast buffet was good enough to make you want to fuel up for walking around the city. The staff were very polite and helpful (they gave us a place to store our cases when we checked out but had a couple of hours to kill in the city). All in all a great hotel for exploring Venice from. Would come back again

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff are extremely helpful; they couldnâ€™t do enough for us”
Reviews.Author: JeaneAOD
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are extremely helpful; they couldnâ€™t do enough for us. Our room was large and very clean as was the bathroom. If you are expecting views of the Grand Canal this isnâ€™t the hotel for you, the views are restricted but it more than makes up for that with its close proximity to St Markâ€™s Square. The buffet style breakfast was excellent, there was an extensive choice.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel and its position were 1st class”
Reviews.Author: codsPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on TripAdvisor before we went, and we were not disappointed ! The hotel staff are friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were cosy comfortable and best of all QUIET. Breakfast was plentiful with a good choice.The bathroom was top quality and sparkling clean. Boiling hot shower and bath, which is what you need after walking most of the day ! The Hotel was steps away from the airport vapporetti stop, and St Marks square. Its within walking distance to all the sights.I had forgotten my adapter plug, but the lovely man on reception went out of his way to find me one, nothing was too much trouble. I would without doubt stay here again, we were going to stay in Mestre, but why go to Venice and not stay in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but small!”
Reviews.Author: BrownieR
Reviews.Content: The suite we booked for 4 is cozy but on the smaller side. It is not in the main hotel building but is a block away. We were generally comfortable staying there. What somewhat unsettled us was on the day of our check-in. The reception staff asked to retain our passports for about 15 mins so that he could register us, while we checked into our room. While we understood his good intent of wanting us to be comfortable, we voiced our discomfort about not having our passports with us and advised that we would prefer to wait at the reception. But he assured us that he would take good care of our passports. We gave in and checked into our room. When we returned 15 mins later, we were appalled to see our passports left on the counter - unattended! Apparently he was dong data entry and was interrupted to attend to another guest at the internet station. He left our passports open and unattended! After that, we stood there and watched him finish up what he needed to do! The most ironical thing the same reception staff told us when he returned our passports is that we should take good care of our passports and keep them under lock and key! Despite the above, we must say that we still enjoyed our stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, located an easy walk from St Marks”
Reviews.Author: misscrackers
Reviews.Content: Everything is withing easy walking distance from this quite little hotel. They had double booked our rooms so we were both upgraded to one bedroom appartments just around the corner. One had two single bed in when we arrived and although we said that was fine we came back from our wandering and they had replaced it with a king bed. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the reception manager went out of his way to ensure our stay was pleasant, he recommended several restaurants and we took him up on 3 of his recommendations to discover the best food we had had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “a good little hotel tucked away from traffic”
Reviews.Author: richa_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this well kept hotel that was tucked away from the "traffic" yet only a seven minute walk from St Mark's Square. No main canal views from our window, but the rooms we were in were tidy, clean and quite large for an European hotel. Mind you, three of us were in superior rooms, which were a bit more expensive, but quite reasonable. The fourth room was a standard and was more typically European in size. The washrooms were sparkling clean and well kept. Heated towel racks seem to be a common theme in Italian hotels. A nice complementary breakfast was included with both hot and cold items available. Their coffee could have been better though. The people at the front desk were very helpful and pleasant; Gabriele, in particular, was an outstanding employee. Thanks all for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kanzi75
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very friendly. Our room was nothing spectacular, but it had everything we needed and was clean. It also had a nice patio over a courtyard. Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 perfect days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: logimorph
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony, top floor. Lots of clean space, very comfortable bed, very friendly reception staff. Small balcony, but then they said it would be, and weather was not warm enough to sit out much. Good scrambled egg for breakfast with streaky bacon and spiced sausage and doppio espresso. The local restaurants were better value than the ones nearer St Mark's Square...just 10 minutes walk away. Hotel is very near the Pieta, where Vivaldi ran the music. Not cheap, but then that's Venice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but compare with other hotels.”
Reviews.Author: sirwww
Reviews.Content: Two night stay prior to cruise. Very good location although the hotel is in an alleyway. We booked and paid way ahead but I felt the rates were still a bit high since we two couples were given the two smallest rooms in the place, based on the room layout map. We four declined an offer to stay in a room which was like a one bedroom loft at a ski resort Breakfast was just ok. The staff were helpful, but I have to mention that one man, tall and slim with gray hair, was quite rude when I asked him a few routine tourist questions, in the AM before setting out. Overall experience was positive.

Reviews.Title: “You have found your hotel in Venice right here!”
Reviews.Author: nerv0usflyer
Reviews.Content: Bisanzio is a wonderful hotel about 5-10 mins walk from St Mark's Square at a slow amble. We were greeted with warmth and friendliness. In fact, the guys on the reception desk were the friendliest reception folk we have come across in all our travels. With its location close to the vaporetto, this made an ideal base for exploring Venice. Yet it was just far enough from the main thoroughfare to be peaceful and quiet. Best of both worlds! The room was spotless and we looked out onto a small courtyard with a glimpse of canal. The bed was comfortable and there is free wi-fi in the bedrooms - to be commended in this day and age. If you don't bring your laptop, there is a computer in the lobby. Hope to stay here again. Recommendations for dinner: Da Mamo for around 30 Euro a head (great pizza and pasta along with a great bottle of house red for 15 Euro) or Beccafico which will set you back slightly more. Both were great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pre cruise stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Willa19
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly helpful staff, great breakfast , very clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff of Bisanzio made my trip easier”
Reviews.Author: r_yeu
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Best Western Bisanzio before (2 nights) and after (1 night) our cruise. This hotel is very convenient to water taxi, Alilaguna stops (San Zaccaria), ACTV stops, restaurants, shops, and not to mention San Marco (10 minutes to the east of the hotel). The reception is extremely friendly and helpful. We checked in after 5PM during our first stay and they had our room/key ready within 30 seconds. They let us go to our room to relax while they prepared the paperwork. When we were ready to leave the hotel for dinner, they had the paperwork ready for us to sign, a map and a guide of Venice which we never requested. But of course, the map became very helpful when we toured around the city. When we returned to the hotel after our cruise, they were more than happy to hold our languages before the check in time and again, we only spent less than a minute at the reception when we finally checked in. We had Room 101 and 105. Room 101 is a good size and comes with a bath. Room 105 is smaller and comes with a shower only. Both rooms have mini-bar, flat-screen TV, safe, windows that open, and an in-room temperature control. I think the room rate came with breakfasts but we never had a chance to have them. I think itâ€™s important to point out that the Bisanzio hotel is equipped with an elevator which is not a standard thing in smaller Venetian hotels. We came across 5 reception staff (in total) during our stay and they were all very friendly and helpful. For the location of the hotel and the friendly staff, I would strong recommend this hotel to anyone not to mention I would go stay with them again when I am in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above the rest”
Reviews.Author: maestro
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location; easy to get to from the public water bus Location is great for walking around. We woke early on Saturday morning and went for a pleasant walk, catching the brilliant colors of the early morning sunshine. Large room. We booked using Best Western Rewards and received a lovely room on the 5th floor. It featured 2 levels with a vaulted beamed ceiling. Though our view was of rooftops and other buildings, it was pleasant nonetheless. Big bathroom. Not your standard European water closet, this one was spacious and bright courtesy of a skylight in the ceiling. Free in room wireless. We needed to call MasterCard in Canada and our 15 minute call was a breeze using Skype and ITouch. Good breakfast. A large, comfortable dining area with a buffet offering scrambled eggs, fruit, yogurt, cereal, etc., juice, coffee, etc. Pleasant lobby to complement the pleasant staff. We stored our luggage for free, picking it up late in the afternoon after touring the city by public water transport.

Reviews.Title: “The Bisanzio was the perfect hotel for our trip to Venice.”
Reviews.Author: chuck1993
Reviews.Content: The best western Bisanzio hotel in Venice was superb. Our room was spotless, the staff were very helpfull and the location was perfect. It is at the end of an alley which makes it quiet (our room looked out onto a courtyard/square which we never saw anyone in), but within 5 minutes walk you can be in St. Mark's square. The breakfast room is very nice and the food and especially the service was great. Lunch on a budget: try the Camponile bar for great value food and drink. It is a small corner bar which is down a side street off St. Mark's. At the 2 lion statues at the left side of the basilica as you face it, go doen the alley for about 150 yards and it is at the left on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Location is quiet and nearby St. Marks”
Reviews.Author: Woozster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, very near all attractions, yet quiet and peaceful. The staff is friendly and informative and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: righthandbat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those wishing to be in the heart of Venice, yet get a good night's sleep. Bisanzio is just 1 minute from the Canal Grande in between Arsenale and San Zaccaria, with San Marco/Doge's Palace 10 minutes walk away. If you get the Alilaguna water bus from Marco Polo airport you can get off at either Arsenale/San Zaccaria, depending on which line you take. It is then a short stroll to the hotel next to the Pieta Church. Staff are most friendly and helpful and speak perfect English. The room (we had a small balcony with a pleasant view of Venetian rooftops) was large and airy and most comfortable with a decent shower/bathroom. Rooms were cleaned daily to a high standard and a hot breakfast inc eggs, bacon, tea/coffe/juices and many other cold items was on offer. A small lounge for relaxing with Internet was on hand if required. Be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and obnoxious front desk attendents, good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: luke35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bisanzio at the end of August. Our travel agent highly recommended the place but upon arrival were greeted with much attitude and arrogance. The information book in our room informed us that internet was included but when our son inquired they told him that it would be a $5 fee since we did not book with the right company. We don't know who the right company is? Each time we asked for directions and information the front desk attendents seemed bothered and annoyed and helped very little. Had we not prepayed this hotel we would have left immediately and gone elsewhere. Also, our safe in the room did not work and I asked if we could keep our passports at the safe at the front desk. The front desk attendent rudely said no and that we didn't know how to work the safe. We were shocked!! We would not recommend this place to our dog!!

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Wendulka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of august for a few days and we loved it so much we decided to write a review. The hotel is in great location, five minutes from San Marco square but by venetian standards, the price was extremely reasonably for the location; our room was big and perfectly clean, lots of storage space, big comfortable bed, and the staff in the reception and everyone else were friendly and helpfull. My fiancee also likes to have one drink in hotel bar before bedtime when we are on holiday and there is a lovely little bar, sofas and easy chairs, which appeared deserted around 10pm on the day we've been there, so we could stretch out on the sofa, turn the lights down and have a romantic drink and chat before going into the room, just perfect. Also, the room price included breakfast, which was a lovely big selection of two types of ham, salami, cheese, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages, rools, toast, and some sweet pastries, and jams and cereal; considering that in the last few hotels we stayed in the 'contiental breakfast' consisted of a few sweet pastries and i'm not keen on sweet, i was really glad to have a good choice at breakfast in Bisanzio (not to mention that Venice is shockingly expensive and we could not get a meal under 100 euro, so it was nice to have the breakfast included). I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Lippy48
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this hotel in Venice and it was amazing. It was a surprise for my birthday. The room was fabulous (503) with the roof terrace which is behind St Marks Sq. The staff ,in particular Gabriell were excellent nothing was too much trouble. The location is perfect as it is very central but not nosiy. Please stay there if you can , beautiful and very romantic, elegant everything you would want for a hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Greenballoon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. We were prepared for the Venetian August heat and crowds having been to Venice in August before and this hotel was an absolute oasis. Within a few minutes walk of St Mark's Square, the Rialto Bridge and a vaporetto station the hotel was perfectly situated for our needs. We decided to have a private water taxi to and from the hotel to the airport at a cost of 110 euros each way including a tip. This appeared expensive but it removed the hassle of carrying luggage for different legs of the journey and we were in the hotel within 30 minutes of landing at the airport. As we arrived too early to check in the hotel stored our luggage for us and the room was ready on our return from lunch. The room, although small was adequate and was spotlessly clean. We were on the first floor overlooking a small alleyway and consequently we heard very little, if any nightime noise. All the staff we came into contact with were very helpful and friendly, particularly the waiting staff at breakfast. Although the hotel was busy we never had to wait for a table as the staff swiftly cleared away any dirty crockery from previous diners. The buffet breakfast was fine, although there was limited choice for anyone wanting hot food. The hotel doesn't serve evening meals and we ate out at 3 restaurants. The best one by far was 'Da Mamo' just around the corner from the Rialto Bridge and recommended on 'Trip Advisor' ( I have put a posting on the 'Da Mamo' restaurant 'Trip Advisor' list) and it was absolutely excellent. I would definitely advise making a reservation as there was an enormous queue when we left around 9. All in all an excellent trip and I would recommend the hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karthics2
Reviews.Content: The room was great and had Cable tv, minibar, nice clean beds and nice shower. The service we receive was great and it was easy to find. Make sure you get on Line blue or Line red Alilaguna water shuttle to San Zaccaria stop. go straight and follow the Calle della Pieta.There is a sign on the ground at the top of the road saying Hotel Bisanzio follow it . The hotel is at the bottom.

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem-Esp the Apartments”
Reviews.Author: irishtourerIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Casa (i.e. apartment down the street) for 4 nights and what a lovely gem it turned out to be. It worked out fairly reasonable compared to everything else in Venice. Location, its very close to San Marco (5 mins walk) and 30 mins to train station if theres no slow coaches walking in front of you. P de Roma is about 40 mins walk. The place itself: The breakfast room and lobby are lovely, staff couldn't be nicer. Apartment is in a building down the street, newish enough with 1 bedroom, bathroom and living room/kitchen. Air Con was great but rarely needed. Only bad thing was noise from people upstairs (just general walking around noise) and don't leave windows open at night or else you will be woken. Hint: Find shop around the corner from apartment or else CoOp down by Arsenale if you want your cheap water and supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Trip!”
Reviews.Author: JumpJet
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Bianzio before joining a cruise ship. We were an extended family group of grandparents along with mum & dad with two children. Our ground floor family room was large, spotlessly clean and nicely furnished with a double bed and fold-down bunk beds for the children. There was a satellite TV and a mini bar, the bathroom was also very good. The grandparents thought their room was rather small buy it was acceptable. The staff were brilliant in that we needed a restaurant booking for us as the Bisanzio doesn't have it's own evening restaurant and we were arriving at 19.30. I rang aheda from the UK and told them it was their choice. We arrived on time and I fully expected the reservation to have been forgotten about, but it had been done and they even provided a map to help find the nearby restaurant! Dinner was great. Breakfasts were in the hotel's own dining room, these were absolutely fine. We took advantage of the free trip to the island of Murano and the glass factory. This was well worth doing and a pleasant way to spend the morning. The best things about this hotel were the amazing location and the friendly and knowledgable staff. Worst thing, only a small point I know, but the sound insulation wasn't up to much. The first morning we were awoken by the TV in the next room, we could hear every single word of the BBC World Service breakfast news!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jandsmansfield
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice and it met all our expectations. This hotel was an example of this satisfaction. The worst thing I could say about it was that it was a little difficult to find. Aside from that point the hotel was excellent, the staff were cheerful, helpfull and unfailingly polite. The breakfast was fine and the location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, shame about the management atitude”
Reviews.Author: AJMKRC
Reviews.Content: A lifelong abition to get to Venice has now been met! Been there done that- loved most of it. Hotel Bisanzio is in a great location, and would appear to be good value for money. The front desk staff are polite and very helpful- and really try to assist you in any way to enjoy a VERY busy city. Do not attempt to converse with the mangement, it just is not worth the effort, even if you are trying to compliment them on the Hotel. During a conversation with the front desk team on our 2nd day I had mentioned that I was surprised that out room didnt have a "small terrace" as I had I thought I had booked one that had this. Not to worry as I am very happy with the room we had, but i would like to view that terrace room if one becomes available. I do not want to change rooms, but would like to inspect one in any case. No problem so far- "the room type is not available at the moment, but we will let you know" was as far as the conversation went with the staff member when the manager came over and took over our chat. "Not possible to book that room unless you book direct with us" ( I hadn"t- i had in fact booked the small terrace room through a major booking link, as you can find on sites like this one) I tried in vein to say that i was happy with our room and didnt want to move, but had no chance of even gettting the words out due to being berrated verbally once more. To this i decided to pull out my booking confirmation that stated this room type which made no difference- "It is not correct" i was told- I gave up communication w him. the Hotel is great, the location, whilst it can get a bit of noise, is handy to the Ducal Palace, St Marc's etc- the breakfast is quite average but we found many small places to enjoy great food nearby. Don't allow yourself to be talked AT just go elsewhere. many places nearby just as good and just as good value. The superior room we had was quite large (for Venice) Noisy- but adequate and fairly priced- just not what we expected I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Apartments are a good option for independent travelers”
Reviews.Author: gohuskies2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment managed by the Bisanzio. At first I was taken slightly aback by the loud air conditioner and scarcity of the furnishings but as we settled in we found that we liked the extra space and amenties provided by the apartment. Our apartment had a large living area with kitchenette and separate bedroom. It was supposed to have a clothes washer but did not. The staff generously washed/dried our laundry at no charge to us. In a compact city like Venice, the space felt luxurious. Our rate plan included breakfast at the hotel, daiily maid service, and free Internet access in the lobby. It was the best of both worlds with the flexibility of the apartment and the services of the hotel. The location is also great. It is a short walk to St. Mark's Square but is peaceful and quiet with many local residents sharing the nearby bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: MIHAELA79
Reviews.Content: HI! My name is Mihaela. My husband and I have been to Venice on 26th of June and we stayed for 3 nights at Bisanzio Hotel in the heart of the city. I have to say that I looked a lot on the internet to find a good hotel from every point of view. I read lots of reviews and I decided that the Bisanzio Hotel was what I was looking for. I have been advised to take the ALILAGUNA service from the airport to Venice because was the cheapest way, although it will take an hour to get there. We got to the hotel and the staff was very nice to us. We were given a twin room, but that's been changed with a double room right away. You have to tell them if you're not happy with something, they're very receptive. The hotel has internet-you have to pay 5 euros a day, though-, a lift, which helped us a lot and the rooms have conditioning air which made our stay very pleasant, especially because Venice was very hot last week. We had breakfast included in our room and I am glad I took it, although I didn't read good reviews about it. Believe me, you have quite a variety to choose from and the staff is very responsive to your requests. Overall, the hotel is excellent not only as position, just 5 minutes away from the square San Marco, but as cleanliness and price as well. TIPS Take the offer to visit Murano. It's arranged by the hotel, a free ride by the water taxi. It's fantastic, I liked it a lot. Every room has a mini-bar, but you have to know that's not for free.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western claims on best rate guaranty are false”
Reviews.Author: Devsarkar
Reviews.Content: I'd booked a room for this hotel on the Best Western website and found a cheaper deal on Booking.com later. When a raised a claim against their best rate guaranty for a refund, it was rejected on the grounds that the room categories were different, which they weren't!!! Clearly the best rate guaranty is a marketing gimmick with no actual intention of refunding any difference. Even if you are staying in a Best Western, make sure you dont book on their website. The Hotel itself: Location is perfect. vaporetto stop is a short 10 mins walk. St Marks sqare and cathedral and 10 mins and Rialto about 20. Rooms are clean, bathroom is spotless. Breakfast is sufficient. There are 2 flights of stairs inside the room to get up to your bedroom!!! Really inconvenient for us with heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Post Cruise Hotel - Great location - Easy to find”
Reviews.Author: kms_PA
Reviews.Content: My hudband, myself and another couple stayed here for two days after a cruise. We paid $217 per night w/breakfast. Hotel was easy to get to from the port. We took the public water taxi right from the port area to Saint Marks Square. (6.50 euro/person & 3 euro per bag) The hotel was 10-15 minutes walk along the water. Very easy. I would not recommend getting the breakfast since there are so many little cafes around. The front desk gentlemen were very pleasant and helpful. They watched our bags since the rooms were ready when we arrived at 9am. The rooms were ready at noon when we returned. The rooms were nice with windows that opened and looked out over the alleyways/streets below. It was cool so we left them open at night. Everything in the rooms was fine, the beds and pillows were confortable. The bathroom was a decent size. The private water taxi stop to get to the airport is one block out to the main area along the water. Great Location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to St. Mark's Square"”
Reviews.Author: lynniepie
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel close to St. Mark's but quiet and off the beaten path. The Bisanzio also had family rooms where we could have separate sleeping areas, my main reason for booking. It is right down the Calle Della la Pieta, just steps from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop for the airport vapporetto. Our room was out the door and down a small alley in a separate building. Three rooms: bath, separate bedroom and a combo living bunk bed area. The room height was a bit low especially in the bathroom but spacious for as much as you are there. Breakfast was great and although I didn't think I booked the package with breakfast the men at the desk said yes it was included. Around the corner away from the waterfront are just alleys and calle's of small shops and restaurants to wander. Pleased with my choice. We did take the free ride to Murano from the hotel, a speedboat which was nice after riding the crowded vaporettos, did the tour of the shop and actually enjoyed it , my son got to blow glass, and we did not walk out with a chandelier! We caught a vaporetto back. Easter weekend in Venice was packed, much more crowded than when we were there in the past, don't think I would do that again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hideaway.”
Reviews.Author: gingaa
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. Yes, it is expensive but then this is Venice. The location is superb just 5 minutes from St Marks' square. One minute you are walking down the bustling waterfront, the next minute you go down a deserted side street and there the hotel is, as quiet and calm as can be. The staff speak amazing English and are a goldmine of information about Venice and how to get around. Our room was not huge but perfectly adequate and beautifully furnished. Tea-making facilities are delivered to your room on request. Being a Best Western the Internet was free and that made for a happy teenage daughter! There are many nearby restaurants and some are even reasonably priced! The city is very safe and there is no need to worry about deserted side streets or going out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: youngworldtravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a friend and after checking/comparing prices we decided to book a room for 130 Euros a night. The hotel was pretty easy to find despite being on an a small side street. We got a room on the six floor with a balcony, big bathroom and a huge queen bed. I have to say by European standards this room was absolutely huge! Fairly comparable to an American hotel room. The bed was very comfortable and as I said before huge (three people could easily fit.) The bathroom was nice - the only downfall was that my boyfriend is very tall so he had a hard time using the shower because it was placed under a slanted ceiling. Breakfast was included in the room price (not typical in Europe.) Breakfast was a typical European breakfast with cold cuts, coffee, nutella, bread - they also served bacon, sausage and eggs. The staff was very friendly and helped us out with restaurant recommendations as well as places to see in one day. Best service and hotel we have been to in Europe thus far! We highly recommend it! We can't say all rooms were as big as ours but if you are looking for a great room request to be places on the 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: sasingh
Reviews.Content: hotel was conveniently placed - one minute walk from the Grand Canal. You walk through an alley way and you are at the hotel. Very hot in the rooms but thats good after spending the day walking around in the cold. Breakfast was crap - if you like toast then thats fine but i would have expected more when on holiday i.e. some pastries or even fruit. Internet can be used for 5 euros for 24 hours which is good but there is only one PC so you may have to wait. Room walls are thin so we could hear the neighbours flushing the toilet, talking to each other etc. But beds are comfortable - showers are very small but again for a short break away it was fine. to get from the airport to the hotel you can buy a 6.50 euro ATV ticket which lasts for one hour. Get on the number 5 bus which goes to Piazale Roma. You then get on a ATV waterbus for your stop. You need to check which number goes where. very easy to use and very conveninent. You can sit outside and do a tour around the island. Because Venice is so small you can walk and may not need a ATV ticket so get there see whats its like before you buy - they arent cheap and a waste of money if you are not using it.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Comfort and Price, Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: enjoyurlilfe
Reviews.Content: Great location 3 minutes from St Mark's Square I went there every day just to be around the crowds and eat. I tour all the areas including the prison. I visited the Ghetto and the island of Signoretti! Just beautiful. I learned all about the way the women and men were sitted or standing in different areas so that they would stay focus and so much more. I think that my photos speak for themselves. Venice is a beautiful place to visit but even better for lovers. The hotel was very spacious and very clean. The Breakfast was more than enough to last you til dinner! I walked the alley ways and shop at the different store and ate at many of the restuarants! I got lost many of times but I would always asked which direction is St. Mark's Square and then be able to find my way back to my hotel by the Riva Degli. During my stay in Venice, I felt very safe and comfortable walking around! Only advice is when your departing late nite don't do it alone! when I got to the vaporetto people were there, but I was told that when the two women first arrived there, there were a man lurking aroung them and then decide to leave. So be careful late nite alone. I always hung out just before nite fall, but I felt very secure and safe there and the hosptality was great. They advice me on what restaurants to go to depending on what I had in mind for the day. They also arraigned my tours. Lovely and friendly people!! Will definitely stay there again or anytime I'm back in Venice! Highly recommend this hotel for their comfort, friendliness and price!! Thank you Hotel Bisanzio for your hospitality! You made my visit to Venice a wonderful adventure alone!! (~,~)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet convenient location”
Reviews.Author: thecooks2000
Reviews.Content: Very convenient and quiet hotel. Close to vaporetto stop. Short walk to St. Mark's. Rooms are small like all in Venice but quite comfortable, staff friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: welshrode
Reviews.Content: To find -no problem ,which can be a problem in Venice with the hidden streets.Good reception very friendly and extremely helpful.Small hotel which has a family feel.The room was a bit on the small side but you do not expect much more in Venice ,have had a lot worse.Great showerroom and warm in the room for that time of year(god knows where the heating comes from?)went there on Air miles so did not have breakfast and really cannot comment on valure for money,but if I had to pick anywhere to go in Venice to stay i would try here again

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, knowledgeable staff, own apt. to stay in near hotel, wonderful accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: americangirl00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 10 nights in Venice at the Bisanzio and due to staying more than three nights were given the option of staying in a hotel room or having our own apartment just an alleyway, a bridge, and a local square away from the hotel, with a litchen, local market right around the corner, and full maid service daily. The apt had a bedroom, full bath, kitchen with cooking, dishwasher and washer dryer and full fridge,as well as a livingroom. Internet access was available in the hotel lobby for an additional 5 euros per 24 hour period.
