The apt was heavenly, the staff always gracious, helpful, all front desk staff spoke at least three different languages, they gave us maps, helped with recommendations for dinner, sites to see, as well as which of the vapporettos went where, and advised us to save money on expensive water taxis and take the vapporetto out to the airport at 13 euros each vs the 110 or more charged by the taxis. We would go back and stay there again in an instant. The hotel itself (we stayed in one of the main hotel rooms the first night as we arrived too late to get into the apartment) is gorgeous and has elegant rooms. We did not take the breakfast at 12 euros each daily as we like to do our own cooking or choose our own place to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheepmadang Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bizanzio in Venice is tucked up in Calle dela Pieta, just minutes from St Mark's Square and a stone's throw from the lagoon front & Vaporetti stop. The reception/bar is modern, bright and welcoming with marble and murano glass. We requested a specific room (501) which is on the top floor. There is a lift, and then you have to take a flight of stairs inside the room. The room has windows on 3 sides looking out over the rooftops of Venice. It has dark wood flooring, wooden roof beams and Murano glass fittings - large by Venice standards and very comfortable. The bathroom is bright, fully tiled and kept spotlessly clean. It was a cold November weekend and we needed the central heating which worked well. The minibar was always kept well stocked for us. Breakfast is buffet style with hot sausage/egg/bacon (unusual for Venice) and all the standard cold meat, cheese pastries etc. I would highly reccommend this hotel as great value - we paid Â£90 per night for B&B for 2 (not bad with the exchange rate today!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, lovely rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: Sorcellere
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a couple of minutes walk from St Marcs Square and was easily located near the shopping areas and a number of restaurants. What I loved most about this hotel was the helpfulness and the friendliness of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was a selection of meats, cereal, breads and bacon sausage and eggs. The internet connection was average but much better than some other areas of Venice. All hotels in Venice seem over priced but baring this in mind, this one was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service!”
Reviews.Author: travelmates2009
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our travel agent based on reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed! We were warmly welcomed, and apparently were upgraded to a (small) room with a large well-equipped bathroom, a balcony and great view. We arrived with only a few euros, so the front desk manager volunteered to "lend" us 80 euros to pay our tour guide (so as not to keep her waiting while we searched for an ATM). The location is one block off the Zaccaria vaporetto stop, on a quiet street, with several charming trattorias less than a 5-minute walk for lunch and dinner. The buffet breakfast is adequate, and the bar is small, but Marco served as a charming bartender and chatted with us (standing) for close to an hour as we sat on the 2 barstools and drank single-malt scotch; he recommended that it be served neat, which is how I now prefer it! Ciao, Marco!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sledz
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was excellent and helpful. We stayed in a family room with bunk beds and a loft with a king bed. Convenient location, breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at Hotel Bisanzio”
Reviews.Author: nickiwarner
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I visited Venice and stayed at the Best Western Bisanzio for our Honeymoon last year. We loved it so much, we came back this past August with two other couples (who also stayed at the same hotel). It was our anniversary and they placed us in the same room as our honeymoon. We thought it was great that the staff remembered from the year before. The location is wonderful and easy to find. Take the Arsonale stop, go two bridges to the left and take a right down the first little alleyway (there is a sign on ground right at the entrance for the alley). The rooms are nice and big for Europe. It's right by San Marco square and near the water. The front desk has great recomendations for restaurants and bars in the area. The only negative we had was that the breakfast staff was rather rude (They'll bring you a Cappuccino, but they won't be happy about it).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: buckyjai
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location., right around the corner to San Marco. The rooms were comfortable and a decent size in comparison to other hotels in Europe. It is easily accessible by vaporetto. I took it from the rail station when I arrived and to the airport when I departed. Breakfast was pretty decent too. I would stay here again next time I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but everything else is just average”
Reviews.Author: politikgirl
Reviews.Content: First thing's first - the Best Western Bisanzio is in a fantastic location just steps off of the Riva degli Schiavoni and many vaporetto stops, and only a 2 or 3 minute walk from the Piazza San Marco. For the money we paid (which was not a small sum), we were glad to find that our money was well-spent vis-a-vis location. As for everything else: average. We stayed in a quadruple room in a building right next to the main hotel building, so we had to go outside for just a few seconds everytime we wanted to head to the main building, but given how small buildings are in Venice, this was OK. The service fluctuated between excellent (when one receptionist was on duty) and poor (when a different receptionist was on duty), so it seems that service was very dependent on who was on duty at a specific time. Breakfast was good. The rooms themselves were clean and functional but nothing beautiful. I would probably come back for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: keentraveller47
Reviews.Content: We loved it people very friendly location location location would recommend this hotel 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Smart, quiet and welcoming hotel in a great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mytrippp
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited us superbly on our Venice visit - mainly because of the location and because it was a quiet, but also because of the welcome offered by all the hotel staff. When choosing a Venice hotel, location really is the most important factor. This hotel was near to St Marks and less than a minute's walk from the water front. Shops and restaurants are just minutes away. Yet the hotel is in such a quiet location, with just the sound of folk walking along the narrow alleyways and by 10pm it was silent. We could leave the windows open at night (rare for hotels) and get a good nights sleep. There is double glazing so shutting the windows would eliminate most noise, for anyone wanting an afternoon nap or lie in. Air con worked fine and was needed. Hotel provides tea/coffee tray on request. Reception staff was very welcoming - making our arrival in Italy and Venice very positive. Check-in was extremely quick and we shown our room within a minute of entering the hotel. We had a standard room. There was no view, except down to the alleyways (this does not matter really as anyone touring Venice will probably have seen enough sites at the end of a day !). However there were 3 windows on 2 sides of the room which was nice. Probably have to book a superior room for any proper view .

Reviews.Title: “Great location-this hotel has character”
Reviews.Author: Carolina50
Reviews.Content: Our quad room had a bunk bed for our daughters and a queen bed for us. Small room with a unique quaintness. Clean room with large bathroom. Very helpful front desk. This hotel is tucked away so you don't sense the "hustle & bustle" of all the tourist. St Mark's is a 5 minute walk. Breakfast was the only disappointment with no fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for location and staff”
Reviews.Author: J&B_isleofwight
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for 3 nights. Great Location just minutes walk to St Marks Sq. and even closer to the Alilaquna ferry stop for the airport (13 Euros). Staff were all superb and clearly trained to treat customer as king. Will provide free kettle, tea and coffee for your room on request and unlimited supplies of Ice. Rooms not luxury and vary in size but very clean and more than adequate. Do take the Hotels offer of a free bus taxi to Murano Island. No high pressure sales at the glass factory where you are dropped off and a great place to wander and have lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average service,strange rooms”
Reviews.Author: DesiTrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with 2 kids. We were put in an "apartment". While the room looked clean - we had to climb about 50 steps to get to the room itself. Since we went in later in the evening - no one to help lug the luggage around there. Location is great. Get down on San Zaccaria vaporetto stop ( not too far away from Marc's square). Depending on which vaporetto you take you may have to walk up with your luggage one or two bridges ( if you take 2 - you will step out , turn RIGHT and walk up two bridges and look for Bizanzio sign on the pavement on the LEFT - too easy so don't stress). Breakfast was pretty standard and decent both the days we were there. Internet connection fee was cheap ( 5 euros for 24 hours) - but you have to be near by the lobby area. Service staff was mostly ok. One of the guys was complaining too loudly as to how one of the visitors was bothering him for the fifth time as to how to make a call back to US. A/C works pretty pitifully - but don't open the windows - mosquitos do come in. The room was a strange loft type of arrangement with light controls that took a while to get used to. For the money I paid - I probably expected a little bit more. However, if you are travelling with kids - there are not much by the way of options in Venice (or you have to book 2 rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: bbcp
Reviews.Content: Went with my wife and 2 teenagers. We were upgraded to a suite with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms (had originally booked 2 separate rooms). Suite size was incredibly big for Europe; bathrooms were large and recently upgraded. Very helpful front desk, they all spoke English, giving good tips on restaurants. Breakfast buffet was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Gilberto40
Reviews.Content: Super good. Brand new, all clean and neat. Close to Piazza San Marco, boat stations and all.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware! The owner of this hotel ripped us off!”
Reviews.Author: AKATravelGirl
Reviews.Content: Although the staff at the hotel were friendly, the owner is a thief and ripped us off. We pre-paid a family suite at top premium dollar and when we arrived they put us in a tiny room wtih two twin beds and a cot. First the hotel tried to claim we didn't book a suite (being a travel agent, I think I know better!) Then they lied and told us the room type we booked didn't exist. After we physically saw the room we booked by chance as housekeeping was cleanng the "Family Suite" , they admitted they gave our room to a larger family of five. The owner of this hotel is a dispicable liar and offered only a pittance of a refund for what we originally paid. He has since been reported to Best Western Headquarters. Yes, great location but not worth the headache and espcially not worth giving your money to a dishonest person. THIS HOTEL IS DEFINATELY NOT THE WORTH THE TOP $$ IT CHARGES.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: moody79
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too sure what to expect of a Best Western in Venice - but I was pleasently surprised. The rooms are very small and a little on the basic side, but overall it was a nice, clean, no frills hotel. Wi Fi in the rooms and breakfast, again, is quite basic. But the staff were helpful, it was well looked after - but some of the rooms are VERY small - and its pretty well located too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff & great location”
Reviews.Author: lipbalm
Reviews.Content: This great hotel is just a few minutes walk from the vaparetto stop at San Zaccaria, which is on the same line as the boat that runs from the airport & is just off Riva degli Schiavoni. We arrived quite late & were given a warm welcome at the reception desk. Unfortunately I don't know the receptionist's name, but he was really helpful & friendly all through our stay. Whether suggesting restaurants, giving us general information or supplying ice when one of my friend's needed it for a sprained ankle. I was in room 107, a double, on my own, & so had loads of space, but compared to other double rooms in European hotels I've been to when with my partner, it was definitely spacious enough for two people. The room was nicely decorated. The breakfast was good, with a mix of meats, cheese, yoghurts, fruit, scrambled egg etc., certainly enough to keep you going until lunch time. There is a small bar & two waiting areas in the hotel lobby, which are great for a quick drink before bed or waiting for someone. After a long day of sightseeing & shopping, I would strongly recommend relaxing there or popping into The Hotel Metropole , which is just on the right corner of the lane way leading down to Hotel Bisanzio. Have a Bellini made with real peach juice & for a credit crunching â‚¬6!! Hotel Bisanzio is a short walk to The Bridge of Sighs & St. Mark's Square. It's a great centrally located hotel, with great staff & nice rooms. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Sal91106
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a 2 nights stop in Venice on our way to a wonderful trip to Europe, and this was a perfect location! Its a close walk to all locations in the area. However, i really hated how difficult it is to get to the hotels from the airport. I mean after a long flight, we still had a take a very uncomfortable ride on the alilaguna for an hour just to get to the small city. But i guess you have to do what you have to do. They were so nice at the Bisanzio!! They helped us out with restaurants and gave us a nice room! I dont think i would go back to Venice because there's really not much to do or see there., but if i do i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “IDEALY PLACED”
Reviews.Author: jujuontour
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. Close to San Marco, so you can see all the sites with ease. My husband was so impressed when we stepped off the waterbus that had brought us from the airport (13 euros one way and takes a good hour) and within a few mins we were in the hotel. You get off at San Zaccaria, turn right and its on your left down a passageway just after the church. The name is written in the pavement. We had a delightful room up at the top of the hotel with windows on three sides, clean and spacious. Could have done with a bit more storeage space for clothes but it wasnt a problem. No tea/coffee facilities in the room, but if you ask they give you a tray with it all on. Breakfast is a help yourself buffet, plenty there and constantly replenished. Only fault I could find was, no fresh fruit.!! The staff were excellent, friendly and helpful. When I wanted to use the internet just to book in for our journey home, the duty manager offered to do it for me and print out our boarding passes. How nice is that? Eating and drinking in Venice is very expensive. You really do need to wander away from the centre to find restaurants which are a bit more reasonable. Also I was shocked at the amount of dogs mess on the streets, they really do need to sort that out, it spoils Venice - which otherwise is a very beautiful place to spend a long week end.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BusterCT1K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a passable 3-star. The first room we were given lacked a shower curtain and was small; the second was larger and better (but no bedside clock). TVs are small CRT designs. No moisturizer. Not much soap was given. Bedspreads were the old type that are probably washed once a year; bed was comfortable, but the sheets were fairly low quality -- Courtyard by Marriotts are three stars too and their sheets put these to shame. Front desk was knowledgable, but wanted 5 Euro for an internet connection. In my mind, no three-star hotel should be charging for internet. It should be free (see again - free at Courtyards). Gabrielle was very friendly; one of his colleagues, however, was a bit brusque -- possibly due to language barrier. The room did overlook a charming little campo, and was nice and quiet at night. Free breakfast was a plus, and was included in the rate. Breakfast was simple but filling: mostly cheese, meats, breads and eggs (which clearly came from a mixture and were too powdery one morning). Very unfortunately , no muesli, no fresh fruit presentation. Some whole fruit was available, but who wants to get fruit juice all over one's hands in peeling an orange at the breakfast table?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Explorers25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with friends. Very happy with friendly welcome, especially Perantonio at reception who was always willing to talk and explain things about Venice, giving good recommendations. Our lack of Italian was no barrier, as they spoke good English. Kettle etc. was provided on request. Good selection of food at the self service breakfast. This is a great place to stay in Venice, only a short walk from the canal and 7 mins from St Mark's Square. Book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad little place”
Reviews.Author: Rustic1
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little hotel, very convieniently located near St Mark's & the main sites. All of Venice is very accessible either on foot or by water (use the vaporetto water buses, best value or the small Treghetto for a cheap Gondolla ride!). Back to the hotel. The breakfasts were good. The staff were friendly & helpful. The bar prices are on the high side. A little tip. When you arrive in the Plaza De Roma from the airport, the water taxi rank is near the new bridge - you can't miss it. Also, just at the far end of the rank, there is a very useful COOP store with a good supply of reasonably priced beers, wines, spirits and food (of course!) My only criticism of the hotel would be that it is a bit noisy and we certainly didn't appreciate noisy building work on Sunday morning!!! Thought they could have done that on a week day. By the way, if you ask, they provide free tea & coffee making stuff for the room. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes on the whole. The positives outweigh the negatives and since we booked it through Airmiles, it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “30th Wedding Aniversary”
Reviews.Author: KeithandJanet
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a three night stay in this Hotel. It was a few minutes walk from the water taxi drop off point and just a 5 minunte walk from St Marcs Square in other words in was an ideal location. the staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful at all times and the hotel was kept spotless and was overall a pleasure to stay there. Venice itself was flooded till about 11.30 every day but they put boardwalks out which makes it easier to get around or but plastic thigh high boots for 8 euro or just take wellies and you'll be fine. The Italians were all very helpful, friendly and curteous at all times and were only too willing to exchange a smile or two :-) It takes about an hour to get from the airport to St. Marc Square drop off point and costs Â£12 per person and as I said previously once you disembark you just turn right and the hotel is a couple of minutes walk on the left so keep you're eyes peeled for the hotel sign which is on the pavement and you'll see the hotel at the end of a narrow passageway. We didn't bother with a Venicecard and just walked everywhere, much better way to see the city. Take care to check out whether service charge and tip is included in the resturants as it can make a big difference to the cost and check out the price of the wine which is about Â£25 a bottle in the restruants. Overall a beautiful city the churches are incredible and even if you're not a lover of classical music it's worth going to one of the many concerts (Â£24 per person) and check out the ones that have vocals not just the instrument ones.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path in Venice”
Reviews.Author: christileah
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel with a super friendly and helpful staff. It was a little difficult to find as two of the maps that we had showed it closer to St. Mark's square then it was (not that it was far though). The rooms were nice with a large bed (but it was two twin beds pushed together), and a nice sized bathroom that had a tub/shower with heated towel racks. They were a nice treat. It had easy access to the internet (5 euro for 24 hours of service). As with all internet overseas you must leave a copy of your passport everytime you use it, so it felt a little safer to do it at the hotel then at an internet point where anyone could be running the shop. It also had a little 24 hr bar that served a nice glass of wine for a decent price if you wanted a drink while checking you email! Breakfast was nice. It had a combination of both hot and cold foods, but offered little in the way of fruit. There was plenty to get you full though and the wait staff was fairly friendly. The hotel required that you leave the room key everytime that you leave the hotel. After having stayed at another hotel that did this it wasn't quite so shocking, but it still feels weird to leave the key at the front desk everytime you leave. They say it's for security reasons (so they know who is in and out of the hotel incase of fire). We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, it had a convenient location just off the busy center, but still near St. Mark's square and if you wonder through the back streets just past the hotel you will find about 4 great little restaurants and a couple of art studios with amazing work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Location”
Reviews.Author: canuck_traveller66
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for one night in late July, 2008. Found it on Best Western's website, and was not disappointed. Very centrally located just to the right of St. Mark's Square and about 5 to 10 minutes walk to it (depends which way you take). Nice big rooms, very clean. Great shower with lots of hot water and water pressure (something we didn't always get on our trip to Europe this summer). Front desk staff spoke excellent English, very helpful in explaining where to catch the vaporetto, what to see and do, etc. My kids loved the folding bunk bed they had for the night (sort of like a Murphy bed, but not set into the wall). Didn't try their breakfast as we were leaving very early the next morning, but other reviewers on this site liked it. Price was reasonable for Venice considering its location (250 Euros for the one night). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ljant
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to find and very central. Reception staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was a reasonable size with a good size bathroom and all very clean. Good choice at breakfast and a small bar facility with lots of nice wine to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bisanzio recommended”
Reviews.Author: Beerathome
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff friendly and helpful with excellent English. Good breakfast. Our room - 503 - was quiet with a lovely view from the terrace. Hotel in great central position close to everything. Good food at a restaurant called Al Giardinetto at Ruga Giuffa, Castello. Lovely outside space with plant covered canopy. Not cheap at about Â£40 per head for 3 courses including drinks but worth it for your final night! Visit the Camponile, Basilica and Dogues Palace on separate days first thing in the morning otherwise queues will put you off. Great views from the Basilica roof. Pay the 2 euros and go up the stairs almost immediately to the right as you go in. Definately worth it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: GetawaygirlEssex
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very easily, got off the boat at the Arsenale, turned left, crossed 2 bridges and turned right down a small alley way and there it is. It is much more of a walk if you get off at San Marco, especially with cases. Staff so helpful, all speak perfect English and are only too happy to help with any enquiry.We had an attic room 504, very quaint with a beamed sloping roof, did wonder if my Husband would be able to stand up in the shower as bathroom is set in the eaves, but at over 6 foot he assured me it was not a problem.Very clean and room serviced daily. We did not have to leave Venice till 4pm on day of departure and room had to be vacated by 11am. The staff so lovely told us to leave cases and feel free to use the lounge and toilet facilities as much as we needed. If I was being really picky the room was a bit too warm, air con didn't seem to make much difference so maybe a problem if weather really hot, not advised to open windows re mosquitoes, but hotel even had repellants plugged in for those. Breakfast very good also. Super location, less than 5 mins from St Marks Square, a great Holiday and would definately use hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret. Maybe not for long!”
Reviews.Author: kaldonia
Reviews.Content: If you have ever traveled to Venice, you know who expensive it is. You also know that reaching San Marco is a long walk or vaporetto ride. You also know that to reach the other islands (Murano, Burano, and Lido), that it is easier to catch the boat here. It would only reason that with all of the convenience comes a high price. Well, there are hotels with more stars, glitz, and glamour, but for my money, there's no better deal than this hotel. This was our 5th trip to Venice and because of accommodations, our best. Every person I met at this hotel was courteous, attentive, and down right pleasant. No matter what I asked, they were happy to try to assist. We booked 7 rooms for friends and family and started each day with a nice breakfast. Mostly standard Italian breakfast fare but plenty of it. I paid a little extra to have veranda views and it was worth every Euro! The rooms seemed larger than most that we've stayed in here. Definitely the most comfortable beds we've had in Venice. We were directed to several restaurants after asking for suggestions and each was a gem. It's not 4 stars but then again, I rarely stay in 4 star hotels. I'll be back, not just for the rooms, but for the staff. Top-shelf experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value!”
Reviews.Author: URspider03
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We spent the first two nights of our honeymoon in Venice. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating - they let us check in a little early because we arrived in Venice early on a Saturday. We loved the location! It was very close to St. Mark's Square, but far enough away that we were away from the huge crowds. Getting around was extremely easy. The breakfast was good, too!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Noise”
Reviews.Author: Flikster
Reviews.Content: Booked this short stay via airmiles, room 406. After a 4 hour drive to Gatwick and flight to Venice, boat journey to Venice island, feeling tired and worn out, we collapsed into the room wanting sleep, to be interrupted by building work outside the window at ground floor level. Had to go out because the noise was so bad, complained to reception only to be told we'd have to sleep when the workmen had gone. The room was small and the decor a little shabby. Could have done with coffee/tea making facilities. On the plus side the breakfast was good and the location very close to the nearby St Marks Square. Had taken my laptop and unfortunately the wireless network didnt cover our room. Beware of people wanting to rip you off in Venice. Went one night for a pizza to a local restaurant to be offered wine with the meal (but we hadnt seen the winelist first) and was charged 24 Euros for a Soave Table Wine, which came as a big surprise. Needless to say we learned a big lesson from that experience. We did find a cheap but lovely Chinese Restaurant called Tian Jin or something like that where we could have a litre caraffe for 8 Euros. Turn left after crossing Rialto Bridge and walking through the market area,walking from St Marks side, for about 65 metres , look for a red lantern and turn left down a 10 metre alley. The restaurant is on the right. If you can cope with eating Chinese in Venice you will be welcomed warmly and be given ample portions, good value for money. We fed ourselves 3 times at about 30-40 Euros per meal. Compare this to our Pizza meal with wine for 67 Euros and you will see what good value it was. Had it not have been for our noisy experience and the inablity to move us from that room, our assessment of this hotel would have been more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location and good value too!”
Reviews.Author: Clocktowerclaire
Reviews.Content: Booked via Airmiles as had some airmiles to use up and fancied a short break in Venice. Read the excellent reviews and chose the Bisanzio. The reviews are not wrong. Excellent location, so convenient and easy to get to from any of the waterbus stops around San Marco. Checked in easily, and Marco was so helpful as the reviews had suggested he would be, providing a map and some useful info for our stay. Room 204 was lovely, spacious and spotlessly clean. The beds were a little hard so we did not sleep well, but you can't hold the hotel to account for our bed preferences! Breakfast was good, very attentive staff offfering tea or coffee. The only gripe we had was about the noise created by some work that is being done on the outside of the hotel at present, we were awoken at 8.10am by drilling and banging just below our window. When we spoke to staff at reception, they immediately realised how close our room was to the noise and offered to move us straight away to another room. Room 604 was a bit smaller, but in the eaves, with exposed beams and more importantly away from the noise. The furniture was a little more dated but who cares! I was so pleased wiht this hotel for the rest of Venice can be a real rip off and generally staff in restaurants and bars are only interested in making money as you will generally not be a repeat visitor, but the staff at The Bisanzio without exception, go the extra mile to ensure that if you did return to Venice you would return to them - I would certainly do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Easy Access to All Sites”
Reviews.Author: TravelFiend1
Reviews.Content: We arrive at this magical place and after the initial shock of beauty we hurry to catch ferry #82 to San Marco. Bisanzio is not on the water, it is down an alley, so we were lost at first, carrying heavy suitcases over bridges in the rain. You can take a closer ferry but I have forgotten the number. If you take the #82 and get off at San Marco, continue along the water and cross two or three bridges once you reach the statue with the man on a horse on top and figures with lions on the bottom, your left turn to the alley is coming right up. Room #206 is very large and clean, outdated decor, but met our needs. Upon arrival we met Marco, who is the star of this hotel. Marco immediately told us which sites to see in the rain and with the limited time we had. Also a motorcycle fan, he told us how to catch our very early train to Bologna. He was attentive to guests needs, willing to share feedback about locations, and excited to hear about our return from the Ducati factory. My reviews are positive primarily because of his excellent service, because there was another guy there (he wore glasses) that could never bother to even get up from the soccer game or get off his cell phone to hand us our room key. (Note: this hotel asks that you leave your room key with the front desk upon leaving for dinner or site seeing). When the guy in glasses saw our Rick Steves' travel book he started to rant about how bad American's are on tipping. We were quite uncomfortable. If it weren't for the contrast in excellent service by Marco, we would recommend against this place due to this guys bad attitude. (FYI, we tipped Marco and didn't tip the guy in glasses.) Sites: see the Rialto Bridge, take a gondola ride (we paid 100 euro) its a rip off but cool to do once, feed the pigeons in San Marco square, Doge's Palace is cool for paintings but I liked the prison best and the view from the Bridge of Sighs, the view from Campanile di San Marco is well worth the wait in line, try to take the #1 ferry and sit in front for just a cool view of the city. Eats: stand up when going for coffee or tea (they charge a tax if you sit down so a 3 euro cup costs 5 euro if your not careful). Favorite restaurant for just good food was Vino Vino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Otolaryngologist
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over New Years (what an experience!!). I would give the front desk staff an 11 out of 10. They were extremely helpful and disarmingly honest about restaurants. They spoke excellent English and really helped us out on finding different spots that we wanted to visit. They were never too busy to help out. We stayed in a room with 3 beds, which was very large and very comfortable and clean. We were quite happy with it. The location is excellent-it is only a 4-5 minute walk from the eastern part of St. Mark's Square and easy to find. The confinental breakfast was very good. It is located right on one of the canals, and close to shopping and the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Bisanzio”
Reviews.Author: TheGrandTourist
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bisanzio is wonderful! I have stayed in three other Venetian hotels in recent years, but I have never received such great service, attention and quality -- even in a five-star hotel! I can't complain about anything, and I am very discriminating about accommodations. The staff is great (especially Marco at the front desk), the rooms are wonderful and airy (mine even had a view of a little canal), and the hotel is convenient (just a short walk from St. Mark's, the Bridge of Sighs, the Doge's Palace and the Rialto Bridge. Bravo, Hotel Bisanzio for your excellent attention to each and every detail. I will return again and again to Venice. Each time, I will stay at Hotel Bisanzio.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, perfect location !! Best choice for anyone !!”
Reviews.Author: johnmiltom641
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three days stay at the Hotel Bisanzio. Everything in this hotel was perfect. Especially the room which completely overgone my expectations. The staff couldn't have been friendlier.Room was very quiet. I couldn't have found a hotel with a more convenient location than this.Best choice for anyone. John Milton

Reviews.Title: “Well priced neat and clean”
Reviews.Author: OperaCinzia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a â€œwonderful stayâ€� at the Best Western Bisanzio in Venice. We stayed at many hotels in Forence, Rome, Rive del Garda and Verone, and this hotel had the most spacious rooms. Even the tub could fit 2 people. It is so easy to find when you get off at Vaporetto stop "San Zaccaria/San Marco." Make a right after you get off at the vaporetto stop. Go over a bridge/stairs. You will see the hotel's name on the ground! Turn left. Every morning we awoke to the smell of freshly baked croissants. Breakfast was quite decent with cheeses, meats, very strong coffee, juices, jams, rolls, etc. The staff speaks terrific English and everyone was so helpful. They will help you arrange for a free taxi ride to Muranoâ€™s â€œLineaMazzucato.â€� This was a highlight of our trip to get to see a master glass blower. The Island was well worth the trip. There were lots of shops. I bought a lot of Murano glass jewelry that were absolutely beautiful. Before you go to Venice, buy a map in English. Ours was made by Natâ€™l Geographic. It had the Islands and the vaporetto stops along with helpful information. Please go to The Doge's Palace/Palazzo Ducale (on Piazza San Marco). It is most amazing. Then be sure to enjoy the dueling orchestras at night on the Piazza San Marco. Each of the 3 mini orchestras played all sorts of classical and popular pieces, often at breakneck tempos. I almost split my side when they played "Havana Gila." The hotel is near San Zaccaria Church and there are numerous stores that will delight you in this area. You can find the most amazing beads and murano jewelry and collectibles. We ate at a most wonderful restaurant â€œS. Provoloâ€� on Campo S. Provolo [--]. Definitely try the Tiramisu. Sensational! I had Pasta with Shrimp (Gamberi). I never tasted anything more amazing! The second night we ventured to Vaporetto stop â€œSan Staeâ€� to eat at Osteria Vecio Fritolin at the recommendation of the New York Times. At $116 (for 2 people), it was our most expensive meal, however, it was exquisite. We had a Shrimp and Scallop appetizer, followed by a delectable Sea Bass dish. The meal was simple, clean (not saucy), grilled, healthy and scrumptious. In general, this was the only city in Italy where the house white wines were very good. Compared to Rome, Florence, Verona and Riva del Garda, Venice has the best food! It is possible to go dairy free in Italy. No need to spend money on a Gondola ride, as one can see so much on the vaporettos. We would recommend Best Western Bisanzio Hotel and we will definitely be going back to this well priced, neat & clean, charmingly furnished hotel. Book on hotels.com, they have the best deals and their charges are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BrittyandLuigi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bisanzio is in a great location in Venice steps from the water and the public water transportation station, where you can get to anywhere in or around Venice (including Murano, Burano & the train station). The staff was incredibly helpful in every possible aspect. There is an internet point but no CD drive so don't expect to do anything concerning up or downloading to CD. They offer free transportation to Murano but the boat only operates with a minimum of 4 people if you have less than that you have to wait and hope that someone else wants to go. We waited an hour then decided to take public transportation. Bisanzio is very close to Piazza San Marco but that means its further from the Grand Canal and also the train station (at least a 30 minute ride if you get on the right boat, could be an hour). Luca at the front desk gave us his card and told us about a beautiful glass factory in Murano, when we got there they told us they weren't doing any tours but when we showed Luca's card they got us right in on a private tour where one of the masters came out to do a glass blowing display just for us :) The name of the factory is Linea Mazzuccato and was definitely one of the nicest glass factories on Murano, if you go make sure to ask for Nicola, he was our guide, he spoke English very well and was one of the kindest people we met while in Italy. Bisanzio was nice and clean and had a decent continental breakfast, the rooms are by no means luxurious just average but clean, and the a/c in our room was working but just barely. Venice is exspensive so if you're looking for a good hotel at a good price then I definitely reccommend Bisanzio. I wouldn't reccommend it for people who are looking for luxury or romance, there are no views from the hotel and the only food service they offer is for breakfast, no room service or dinner in the hotel. "Al Scalinetto" was reccommended by the staff and was very closeby and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and I must say that the hotel is overpriced. We paid 210 euros per night and the only thing that was worth it was the location. The hotel should use some of the money to renovate. The rooms had very squeaky wood floors. The bed was very old and everything just looked OLD and never updated. The staff was nice and attentive but you always felt that they were shifting you one way for some reason. We asked where we could take the boat to Murano and immediately he wanted to call us a taxi that would take us FREE, but there is a catch and we found out later on. The cab takes you to a factory where you are received by a lady that asks that driver what hotel you are coming from, so you know there has to be commission involved. After touring the factory you cannot go anywhere else but back to where they want to take you. The cab ride back is also free but they dont take you back to where you came from, they drop you off at the nearest part of the island. Luckily from there we were able to take a boat to Burano and missed out on seeing anything else in Murano because we didnt know there was anything else. The hotel staff told us the only thing to see was that factory because all the others only had showrooms. What did we know. The breakfast was nice and warm since it was so cold outside. The bathroom was horrible, the shower was terrible with a plastic floor that moved. We just made the best of it because the location was excellent. You are close to all the vaporetto stops and within 5 mins of St Marks Square. Behind the hotel you can take the small streets that will eventually lead you to shops and restaurants. We paid more than the hotel was worth, but it made our experience in Venice much better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far too hot”
Reviews.Author: gwrjack
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay at the Bisanzio. I loved the hotel which has pleasant rooms, a great location and very friendly staff BUT it was far too hot there to the point we did not get a good night's sleep on any of the three we spent there. When I went to reception to report the problem, I was told that the air conditiioning was off now and the heating on and nothing could be done about it. The air conditioning unit in the room blew out hot air whether you chose hot or cold so we switched it off completely but it was still way too hot. There was a heated towel rail in the bathroom which they did switch off for us. We were at the point of risking opening the windows all night when we saw a man at breakfast who had done this and he was covered in mosquito bites, all over his face poor chap, so we put up with the heat instead. There were lots of mosquitoes about and we managed to kill the ones that got in when we did open the window for a bit. The overheating is madness. I would love to stay there again but only if the air conditioning was working properly. A real shame because everything else about the hotel is great. I was so pleased to get home to get a good night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CypressVancouver
Reviews.Content: We (spouse and I) stayed at Hotel Bisanzio for 4 nights in late Sept to early October. Overall it was pretty good. The room was a close but not tight fit in clean shape. Hotel safe provided. Bathroom was clean and worked fine, even had a 110 v outlet which was convenient. We kept our windows closed due to the street noise starting around 6:30 AM. Being almost cool enough it was OK but the room A/C did not seem to provide much cooling. Morning breakfast was fast and courteous but without too much beyond cereal, yogurt, toast and the basic meat and cheese we found in all our Italian hotels. Room TV was tiny, 16 inch screen. Location was excellent - 10 min walk to St. Mark's and 3 min to the water. Staff were very good, really helpful and easy to talk to. They arranged a free morning boat trip to Murano for a group of us to see glass blowing demonstrations. This was good but be prepared for the sales pitch for the extensive inventory of the attached store. Overall we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: vanlea73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bisanzio for four nights last week with our baby son. We booked through Air Miles. This hotel is so well run. The whole place is spotlessly clean and the standard of daily cleaning was superb. The staff were just the right balance of pleasant and efficient and poured the most wonderful gin & tonics for us! We were made welcome from the minute we walked in until the minute we left. The breakfast was of really good quality, especially the coffee! We had a lovely big room with efficient air conditioning, mini bar and plenty of space. I think we had one of the bigger rooms because we had to have space for the baby's cot which they provided. The bathroom was fine. We were pleasantly surprised by the position of this hotel. We have been to Venice many times before and we like to try and avoid the crowds as best we can so were a bit nervous about choosing a hotel so near St Mark's Square. We were delighted with the Bisanzio though as somehow you felt away from it all, especially once you discovered all the little back routes to get you from A to B without getting tangled up in the crowds of Riva degli Schiavoni. Would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vales
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable and quiet place to stay thatâ€™s right in the middle of things. The Hotel is small nicely decorated and well run. The reception staff are courteous and helpful. The Bisanzio Hotel is situated on a quite street behind the Metropole Hotel, five hundred meters from St Mark's Square. A hundred meters from the Alilaguna and valporetto stops The Hotel room we had during our stay was bright and welcoming with three long windows and a lovely outdoor terrace I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nibbles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of July for 3 nights after a cruise. I chose the hotel because of it's proximity to St Mark's and to the water buses and wasn't disappointed in the location. Our room was very clean, if a bit basic, with a well equipped bathroom with plenty of towels. We stayed in a quad room and I had requested the annex beforehand but unfortunately it wasn't available. Since I was travelling with 2 teenage boys I also requested that they didn't have bunk beds but unfortunately we got a room with bunk beds, the top one looked a little precarious (and small) for a strapping teenager - but was OK in the end, no falling out of bed or collapsing onto his brother!! Breakfast was very basic and unimaginative. 2 juices - grapefruit and cranberry. Cheese, ham, yogurt and a few pastries. As has been said before, the coffee was excellent but providing really hot water for tea proved to be a challenge. The hotel is an efficient, very clean hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. Facilities are fairly basic. There is a small bar area but nowhere to sit with drinks, other than in the small lounge area. The hotel has a computer with internet access but it is pricey and only available in 1 hour packages. Luggage storage consisted of leaving our cases under the stairs and hoping no-one walked off with them. I would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a reasonably priced hotel in a good location. However, unlike many reviews, I don't feel it warrants a 4* rating. This was my 3rd stay in a European city this year and the other two hotels all had great locations but went that bit extra on the rooms and the breakfasts. I know that they do have some very nice rooms at the Bisanzio, we just didn't get one of them. Whilst I wouldn't rule out staying here again, I would probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: HerefordFlash
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, a few minutes walk to San Marco and a couple of hundred meters from the waters edge with water taxis and buses to all locations including the airport. The room was okay, nothing to shout about but clean and good enough for the amount of time you spend there. One tip is to ask for tea and coffee making facilities at the front desk, they will then arrange for a kettle and tea and coffee to be put in the room. The front desk staff where all very polite and helpfull. One down side to the hotel was the breakfast. This was very poor, a small selection of meats, one type of croissants which were not very good and some fruit drink. Apart from the breakfast, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk staff at the Bisanzo was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler0717
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff service was exemplary. It was our first trip to Venice and they gave us great advice on how to see as much as possible during our short visit. The four of us stayed in a family room - which even included a small second bathroom. Breakfast was good and the coffee was amazing!! The hotel was a little hard to find (although there is a great marker on the main canal sidewalk which we didn't see right away) - but actually is VERY conveniently located just east of St. Mark's Square and right off the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LovelyJoBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a quiet little walkway, but still in a great location for exploring all of Venice. About 5 minutes walk from St. Mark's square, and also one bridge to cross from the San Zaccharia vaporetti stop. Our room was quite small and plain - but pleasant nonetheless with a well equipped bathroom. The staff on the front desk were very efficient and helpful, and the breakfast waiting staff were quick to replenish anythying that had run out. Breakfast was a buffet style selection of cereals, pastries and the usual selection of cheese and ham. Not the cheapest hotel in the world - but considering its location, worth it. There can't be many other hotels in this price range with such easy access to the grand canal, St. Mark's and Bridge of Sighs as well as the quiet little backstreets of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: canoe2
Reviews.Content: We flew into Venice and spent a couple nights at the hotel before we went up into the Sud Tirol. We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. My wife and I were travelling with my wife's mother, (who is from Italy) and our two girls 9 & 11. We had two rooms which were on the same floor and one room apart. The rooms were very clean and the hotel staff was wonderful, especially Gabriel, and the breakfast was just enough to start the day. The coffee was wonderful. The hotel was very close to San Marco and the hustle and bustle, but was secluded enough to be nice and quite. The staff was very good at pointing us in the right direction for meals and sights so that we could enjoy Venice. Since there were 5 of us we took a private water taxi from the airport which dropped us off within 100 meters of the hotel and took less than 30 minutes. After seeing folks carrying suitcases around Venice I'm very glad for this! The public water taxi is also very close within 300m. I would definitely go back! Please don't change!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LisaVirga
Reviews.Content: We were two families that both booked the Bisanzio June 15th-18th. At the suggestion of the front desk, my family was moved into a "suite" next door instead of the adjoining rooms we had booked. The suite turned out to be an immaculate "townhouse" of sorts, with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a sitting/entertaining area. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful or pleasant when arranging transportation or offering suggestions for excursions or dinner. We will be forever grateful to Marco for making my son's 13th birthday magical and special. In addition to reserving us an ourtside table at a fantastic restaurant, he made sure were greeted with a complimentary champagne toast, and had made arrangements for a birthday cake to be baked for dessert. He was so helpful and pleasant, and really helped to make our stay magical. The complimentary buffet breakfast was just perfect to start off the day, and the coffee was the best I have tasted in years. The breakfast room was always neat and clean, and there were always seats available. The hotel is in a fabulous location, managing to be both conveniently located near all the major sites and attractions, yet in a quiet little niche affording it's guests some quiet. After seeing some of the other hotels we considered in person (many were a lot more expensive), we were so happy that we booked the Binsanzio and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: BG_67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night prior to joining a cruise ship. We were very pleasantly surprised at the room which was much bigger and brighter than expected. The hotel location, literally minutes from St Marks Square, is in a quiet area but ideally situated for exploration and transport. There are several good restaurants close by. We ate at the Remigio and the meal was excellent and reasonably priced. Go early if you haven't booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel And Location”
Reviews.Author: chilledntanned
Reviews.Content: we have just been to venice and stayed in the best western hotel BIZANZIO just 300mtrs along the front from St. Marks square. it was lovely and clean and the staff were so helpful giving us maps and recommending places to eat that were quiet and reasonable and very tasty!! they also suggested places to visit and spoke english very well which was great because my italian is very bad! the breakfast was modest but plentiful and the ladies serving it were very efficient.it is a great base to visit many of the places in venice, boat stops close by to all areas. easy walking distance to many of the sights and cracking views from the front. we went during carnavale and it was busy but very visual i think it's a great time to go but each will have their own ideas of fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chumpstick
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We expected a tacky hotel as it was crammed down a little alley. But everthing in Venice is like this.We ( wife and 2 kids aged 5 and 6) had our own apartment adjacent to the main hotel which was cleana nd well kept, the staff were friendly and no problems with the breakfast + reasonable selection. The hotel was in the heart of venice couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Intruder3303
Reviews.Content: Good 3* hotel, very easy to reach (recommend to use when coming from airport either Arsenale either S. Zaccaria stop). Close to St Mark square (3 minutes walking), quiet area. Rooms are very clean, not so big (mine had about 12 sqm), but with nice furniture. The air is fresh, no humidity at all. Hotel itself is very clean, staff quite helpful. Breakfast is ok, with different meat starters and pressed cheese. Excellent coffee and croissants. Some few tips: - Free safe at the receptions desk - in room TV stations (cnn, bbc, tv5, vox, rai 1-4, italia 1, mtv), fashion tv - internet point for 10 EUR/hour - luggage room available on the ground floor (after check-out) - central heating for cold/warm air

Reviews.Title: “Charm and cozyness”
Reviews.Author: gatototo
Reviews.Content: Just about the most charming and romantic hotel in Venice. Located in a small and marvelous little street, at walking distance from all atractions. All kind of rooms, all cozy, and great prices. Plus, magnificent attention.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler11
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (husband and 8,12 year old) stayed at Hotel Bisanzio in late August as part of our Rome/Florence/Venice trip this past summer. I have to say that Hotel Bisanzio and Venice were our least favorite part. We ended up in the apartment building next door. It seemed okay at first, down a side street, until our very noisy neighbors moved in the room above us. The apartment had doorbells and their young children had fun ringing our doorbell at 11pm when we had put our kids to bed at 9pm for a very early fligt the next day. When we checked in, we were told that Best Western made a mistake, and put 3 people instead of 4. The man at the desk made certain it was not his fault (nor ours) and ultimately, it was our tough luck (otherwise, I think we could have gotten a better room). The shower was the real kicker - there was a staircase halfway through it. I am surprised people don't hit their heads and get hurt. If you are over 5ft, this leaves you half of the bathtub to stand in, or you can take a bath, but you better stand up on the right side when you get out, or you will slam your head. The breakfast was so/so and in general, we found the food in Venice to be less tasteful and more expensive than the other parts of Italy we visited. Venice is very touristy and everythign was a lot more expensive. Once you see San Marco, the canals, bridges, we didn't find a lot to do and ended up going to the beach for two days. We did splurge and hired a water taxi to take us to the airport for our early flight and although expensive, we are glad we did it for the experience and convenience of not have to move luggage up and down steps and onto the very slow water bus. Given the cost of Hotel Bisanzio versus what the other hotels charge, it is probably a good value, but I would definitely stay away from apt. 115. The top apartment might be better as long as no one is rining your doorbell at night. EIther way, there is a courtyard behind it and people were rolling carts each morning at 6;00am. We would not stay here again, but then, Venice wasn't really our cup of tea either..

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but all right”
Reviews.Author: PO_Traveller
Reviews.Content: In early July, we stayed 4 nights in a Superiod Double with private balcony. The room was fairly large and quiet, the a/c - we stayed during a rather hot time - was working well. The furniture was of good quality, but not necessarily practical. We had to ask repeatedly for a jug, cups and tea etc., which was not replenished during our stay (not even the paper cups. When requests for replenishment were not met, we bought fresh supplies at a local grocery store). We had a view of the balcony of the property next door - about 2 m away. Thankfully, the Italian neighbours were friendly enough people and quiet too. As many others have remarked, breakfast is adequate at best. The location is extremely convenient. The one - and major - bone we'd have to pick is the cleanliness/cleaning. The near-nauseating stench of ammonia-based detergent greeted us from the bathroom upon arrival and would not leave the room throughout our stay. The wooden floors of the room were not cleaned once during our stay. On the last day, no-one at all came to make up the room! (In spite of a polite reminder). The oft-mentioned Mario we found the only staff without a big chip on his shoulder. The others were either aloof or heavily promoting friends' businesses acriss Venice (do stay away from that nearby piezzeria!) Well, this comment probably sounds more negative than in should be. By Venetian standards, the Bisanzio is a fair enough deal.

Reviews.Title: “Bisanzio has a lot going for it”
Reviews.Author: RTullis
Reviews.Content: Our family (50 yr. old parents, daughters 17 and 20 yrs old) stayed for three days/4 nights at the Bisanzio in late July 2006. The hotel has a great location, especially for the price, a short three bridge walk along the Riva to Piazza San Marco. Location is also well-served by vaporetto, making arrival and departure much easier than many other hotels. The Alilaguna service is right at the vaporetto dock, that is the most direct and least expensive way to get to the airport. You essentially get all of the convenience of a water-side hotel without paying for it. It is also easy to find, so if teens go off by themselves, you are meeting friends, or you arriving after dark you have a fighting chance. Being part of the Best Western chain makes it easy to book and communicate with, but once you are there you have no idea you are in a chain hotel (a plus in our minds). The hotel itself is in two combined old buildings that have been extensively and recently renovated. Ambiance is contemporary without being inappropriately avante garde. Walls are all polished plaster, common area floors are marble, private room floors are new wood. Bathrooms, while not large, are clean / 4-fixture / tiled rooms. We had two superior rooms that we booked directly with the hotel after finding a better price online. The hotel could not match the web price, but offered to upgrade us to superior rooms for their regular room price. This deal worked well for us. One room (401) had a pleasant terrace, though we stayed during a heat wave, so really couldn't use it much. Because the hotel is tucked back into narrow Castello streets, there are no real views from the room windows. The terrace provided some bit of a view. Our daughter's room (405) looked into a small courtyard. Air conditioning was more than adequate to fight the heat. A decent sized elevator with front/back door serves (I believe) all floor and half-floor levels. The staff is very helpful, Gabrielle seems to be the information expert, Marco, Tony and "night Tony" all very pleasant. They made restaurant reservations and Murano trip arrangements for us, and I overheard them chasing lost luggage for another guest. The breakfast room and buffet are nothing special, but perfectly adequate, we seldom ate lunch. The seahorse-shaped room key fobs are charming. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, and would stay there again when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: nomad77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is back off the main drag about a block, is very quiet, extremely clean and very well managed. The staff at the front desk was very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. The breakfast that was included was adequate for a continenteal style. Our room (quad) was good size for venice. Some of the photos of the hotel are misleading, but not totally false. If you want a good hotel for your money this is it. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hadleymike
Reviews.Content: Was delighted to find that this reasonably priced hotel was smart, clean and very friendly. Positioned in a quiet side street jus a few minutes from the hustle & bustle of St Mark's Square, it was absolutely ideal for exploring the delights of Venice. The service from the front-desk, small but pleasant breakfast restaurant and the general hotel staff was beyond reproach. I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel to you if you want a value hotel close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the Bisanzio and Venice”
Reviews.Author: sapodillabrown
Reviews.Content: Our group of five booked one quapruple room and one single room at the Bisanzio in June, expecting bunk beds. We were pleasantly surprised that we were allocated the Family Suite located in a building next to the Bisanzio. The family suite had a living area with a TV, one bedroom downstairs with two beds, a bath and another TV, while upstairs in the loft area there were two more beds and a separate bathroom. We could not ask for more from the Bisanzio. Marco at the front office gave us extremely good directions to the hotel from the airport, assisted us with places to go in Venice, and even arranged our walking tour. The hotel is located a few bridges away from St Marks Square (which is a delightful place at night), and we explored Venice from this location with ease. The water taxi is located near to the hotel and with the one day fare, we toured up and down the grand canal and the rialto area. Breakfast was not elaborate, but who needs an elaborate breakfast when there is the whole of Venice waiting to be discovered. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy in which we began our stay in Venice. The hotel is easy to reach via the vaporetto - something that we appreciated due to the amount of luggage we had. The location is excellent, convenient to all the sights in Venice. Our room was decent size, had no view, but the air conditioning worked wonderfully. Upon checking in the staff was very helpful. However the second day the man working the front desk could not be bothered with our questions. Breakfast was more than plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bisanzio Hotel (family of 4 inlcuding 2 teenagers) for 2 nights before a cruise and 1 night following the cruise. For the 2 nights before the cruise, we had the "Superior Family Suite" which consisted of a downstairs level with a living area with sofa, bunk beds, and a bathroom. Upstairs was a loft with a full size bed and bathroom. The room was immaculately clean and very comfortable with plenty of room for all of our luggage. It was a nice luxury having 2 bathrooms, especially with 2 teenage girls! The room was located in a building next to the main hotel building (this building contains the 3 Superior Family Suites). My only complaint about this room is that the bed was hard. The front desk staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. The breakfast buffet consisted of cereals, bread and rolls, yogurt, meats & cheeses, juices and coffee. It was more than enough for us as we are not big breakfast eaters. The location was excellent, within walking distance to all of the sights, shopping, and plenty of restaurants. When we returned to the hotel following our cruise, the Family Suite was not yet ready, so they gave us 2 regular rooms instead (for the same price). Again, the rooms were very clean, a little on the small side but fine for 2 people and were located in the main building. The bed in this room was much more comfortable, although my daughters said the bed in their room was hard. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Bisanzio Hotel, would stay there again, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in Venice and the staff upgraded us (for free) to an hotel owned apartment about 200m away from the Bisanzio. It was spacious and very clean and in a nice location - we were impressed. The staff at this hotel are great. very helpful and friendly - especially Marco at the front desk. The location of the Bisanzio is perfect - close to everything. The breakfast was really good - I am surprised that a few reviews have moaned about it! It was more than adequate and the service was friendly. A nice little hotel which is well run. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!!”
Reviews.Author: jhaynie
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Bisanzio. Small clean rooms. Staff was very helpful, Marco especially gave us some great places to go for dinner which really made the trip special. Great location, reasonable price. Overall, a great experience and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: devon_sire
Reviews.Content: have just arrived back from 4 nights at the Bisanzio. very smartly decorated, immaculately clean, large room, very nice furnishings and shower room, great shower. very good breakfast and extremely helpfull and friendly staff. The hotel is in a great situation and would recommend it to anyone, best 3 star hotel I have stayed in. One minor complaint but that covers most other hotels. Hard beds!

Reviews.Title: “After our Med. cruise, this hotel was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: torilady
Reviews.Content: Luckily, our family had reserved three rooms at this hotel following our Med. cruise that had ended in Venice. The water taxi was able to pull right up to the entrance and our rooms were waiting for us. The staff was wonderful, lovely gentlemen, one of which ended up giving my daughter-in-law a special recipe belonging to his wife. They were attentive to our every need and never neglected to advise us or answer any dining question that we might have. The rooms were not fancy, but extremely adequate. When we departed, a water taxi was waiting for us so close that it was almost in the hotel!! This was great because there were six of us with lots of luggage!! I would recommend this to anyone wanting a comfortable, quiet place to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, busy staff”
Reviews.Author: Bentley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found long reserved room to be extremely small and hotel staff quite absorbed in things unrelated to guests. This was our 4th trip to Italy and this hotel ranks at the bottom or our list. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: buttonbonce
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. It's fairly small and very well run. The rooms are very clean and nicely furnished/equipped .. excellent shower! Our room had a lovely outdoor terrace, perfect for warm afternoons and evenings with nice roof top views. Unfortunately, it was -4 degrees when we visited, so not much use. Breakfast was a lot better than any of the others I have experienced in Italy .. juice, cereals, rolls, croissants, ham, cheese, yoghurts, fruit, various spreads and lovely coffee or tea. Location is good, just off the waterfront and only a couple of bridges away from St Marks's Square. I would recommend this for a good value break. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pinkbunnt
Reviews.Content: rooms are pretty basic but clean and average size. The staff were great really friendly and helpful and the location is great 5 mins walk to St Marcs square. I would recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Garry_Platt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bisanzio between Christmas and New Year. The hotel is easy to find down a small alley leading from the water front. We were greeted and treated respectfully and courteously by the Reception staff. Out room was clean, well maintained and had a wonderful view across a sea of terracotta tiled roofs. The breakfasts were standard Venetian fare, meats, cheeses, croissants and cereals and of course great coffee. This is typical and not unusual, a lot of reviewers seemed to have been expecting a Big Mac with fries, this is Italy, and they are significantly more sophisticated! If you want a large cooked breakfast you can still have it, you just have to pay extra â€“ this is de rigour for Venetian hotels. The Hotel is well placed for disappearing into the heart of Venice and discovering all its hidden secrets and mysterious corners but is also surprisingly easy to find on your return being so close to the Main Square. (It is worth noting that some of the reviews here seem to wander into the shortcomings of Venice or other establishments which is really not a fault of the Hotel's is it?) The Bisanzio is excellent value and when I return I shall be staying here. For the very reasonable price you pay I doubt you will get better value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Best Western Bisanzio Hotel in Venice, the one located on Calle de la PietÃ¡. Well, everything was just perfect, we arrived really late (2am) and the check in was smooth and profesional. The have security boxes for your valuables which are free of charge. The hotel has a working elevator (most hotels don't) and the decor is tasteful and clean. The room was above my expectations, with just what you'd expect from a hotel room: clean bathroom, air conditioning, comfty bed, and closet space. The rate you pay includes breakfast, which is, by italian standars, Ok. You'll get: Juice, Coffee, Toast, Cereal, yogurt, croissants, ham, and cheese. Another great feature is that it is very well located; just a couple mini-bridges away from St. Mark's Square. But at night, its location offers a quiet atmosphere, away from the sound of noisy restaurant or night spots. In summary I give it an A and recommend it openly for everyone that's travelling to Europe on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good value but beware restaurant recommendations”
Reviews.Author: N1Traveller
Reviews.Content: The Bisanzio is reasonably nice and extremely well-located, but the breakfasts were grim. The food was terrible, lacklustre (verging on stale) croissants and rolls, only the coffee was worth having. Also, our room was hot, and the air conditioning didn't seem to work, but when I queried this at Reception they said that it had been turned off for the winter. Neither a fan nor an alternative room was offered. Unfortunately, there was a mosquito in the room, and we got bitten a lot! We had several good meals using the Time Out guide, but we asked the hotel for a recommendation for our last night. Big mistake. They recommended a place called the Giardinetto, where they claimed that the Venetians went .... Ha. We were shown to a table outside in the garden, which was freezing cold, and where the customers were all tourists wearing their coats and not complaining. When I asked to be moved inside, they asked if we had a reservation (we did and had already said so), and gave us a table at the furthest end of the restaurant next to a door in permanent use. The food was mediocre, the soup tepid, and when the waiter brought the bill he stood over me while I looked at it in some amazement since it was for 96 euros for 2 people! I couldn't tell the receptionist about our experience since he was not on duty before we left, but no one asked once if everything was OK with our room or if we had enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven In Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do you want a hotel that is quiet? immaculate? friendly? well located? and IN Venice? I probably shouldnt tell anyone as the hotel will become too popular. The Bisanzio is located a short walk from St Mark's Square and easy to get to from the Alilaguna. The staff are all friendly and helpful. We were there in early September and it is an oasis of calm and respite from the heat (yes air conditioning). We were there four/five years ago and it has not changed but remains really the perfect hotel. My only regret was not being able to take the hotel maid home with me as the rooms are spotless. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Bisanzio”
Reviews.Author: DZTS
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Front desk staff - Gabrielle and Francesco - were great. Room was very clean. Very close to St. Mark's Square. Excellent choice for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: vacation200807
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with an extremely helpful staff and wonderful location. It is literally a 3-5 minute walk to St Mark's Square. When we checked in we were asked if we wanted a little more room - they have apts approx 1500 metres away. We checked them out and decided to go with the hotel rooms, I would recommend the hotel rooms vs the apts, they are a little out of the way and extremely dark and we found it more convenient to be in the hotel itself. We had a family room with a double bed and two bunk beds, nice large room - worked out well. Breakfast was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel, People, Location”
Reviews.Author: bbradyesq
Reviews.Content: My lovely wife and two beautiful daughters, ages 25 and 21, and I met for 4 glorious days at the Hotel Bisanzio in mid-August. Our very quiet family suite was new and impeccably clean, the daily maid service of the highest quality, and the room well-appointed and spacious. We had two floors overlooking a small drawing room, replete with TV having American and British news channels and programming, along with Italian stations. Our room was as comfortably air-conditioned as we desired, even on days when the temperature was in the 90's F. The upstairs shower stream was strong and the water hot, a mini-fridge well-stocked with juices, water, soda, wine and local libations, as well as snack foods. The downstairs bath was quite large, and the hotel stocked all the usual amenities one would expect at a 4 star hotel. The hotel staff were all simply fabulous, taking great pleasure in answering our questions and directing us to proper vaporetto lines, shopping areas and restaurants of their recommendation, and others of our predetermined choice. Tony was especially "simpatico," twinkling his eyes and smiling often, making jokes and doing everything he could to make our stay pleasant. As an example, our three separate flights from Amsterdam, London and Athens were each delayed on arrival. At 7:30 PM after we each had arrived, he called an hour before we wanted to have dinner at a highly sought after restaurant recommended in the Frommer's guide, Trattoria di Remigio (where normally you must book reservations well in advance). He spoke directly with the maitre'de, asking him to please try to squeeze us in as a favor to the Hotel. We dined graciously one and a half hours later at 9 PM. And this on a Friday evening as well. On another occasion I was given superb directions to the UNESCO office, and later, after an unfortunate reaction to seppia (cuttlefish), I was given very specific directions to the Ospitale Civile (well worth visiting next to the fantastic Chiesa di San Giovanni and Paolo and piazza, by the way), where, after communicating in French to the doctore, I was placed on an IV and treated for an allergic reaction. The hotel staff also checked to see if I had arrived OK, and later relayed messages from the doctore who called to check on me after my discharge. Tony translated the doses on my script for medication, and translated what the doctore had said re followup care. The location of the Bisanzio is perfect, adjacent to the Hotel Metropole, literally a stroll over two bridges on the Riva degli Schiavone for ten minutes to Piazza San Marco. It is adjacent to the church where Vivaldi composed many of his masterpieces. Our rate was very well-priced for Venice at 210 Euros per night, the breakfast a cut above the traditionally well-prepared continental fare, with an option for cooked eggs to order for a modest charge if we desired. The juices and coffee were excellent, and everything on the menu in unlimited quantities in a beautiful room decorated with blue stained glass. The photos on the website, while faithful, really don't do this spectacular hotel justice when in person. The Bisanzio truly is worthy of 4 stars, and we can't imagine a better stay and hope to return again soon. Bill Brady, Denver, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ELDerby
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location - short walk to San Marco. The rooms were clean. Staff was friendly. Very affordable for Italy during August. Would definitely stay here on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “great find, easy to find”
Reviews.Author: ohiogo
Reviews.Content: A good comfortable place to stay and helpful staff. They recommended a great area for restaurants, & how to get away from the crowds. First room assigned was a double, not a triple. We politely complained that putting in a roll-away would be too crowded. They offered us a room for 4 -turned out perfect and quiet even though it was by the breakfast room. Everything clean, neat, good sheets, mattresses, etc. As we left, they arranged with a private water taxi for $60 to take us to the Plaza to meet bus to Ryan Air. Worked perfectly. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the nicest places”
Reviews.Author: richdanareese
Reviews.Content: One of the absolutely finest hotels in Venezia. I am in Venezia on a regular basis and never even consider any place else. Location is terrific. It is a quiet and restful haven near by but away from the hubub of San Marco

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sidney2007
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to everything. Lovely clean rooms. Helpful staff. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Anoini2
Reviews.Content: The room is clean and the breakfast is very nice. It's close to St Marks Square and the staff are very friendly. The only negative was that they recommended this new waterfront restaurant that's close to the hotel and it was awful and expensive. If your in a hurry to get to the hotel vaporetto 51/52 is much faster than taking 1 which goes through canal grande. The hotel also gives you a complimentary map so you don't need to buy maps infront of the station. We only took the vaporetto on our way in and on our way out. It's nice to walk (and get lost) around Venice. Venice has a lot of bridges so comfortable shoes and a small luggage will make your holiday more enjoyable. And another thing...watch out for dog doo doos, they're everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a really cozy and beautiful little hotel. Rooms are small but really charming, as well as the street where the hotel is located. Walking distance to San Pierto and all other major attractions. Great value amongst venetian hotels. Highly highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment”
Reviews.Author: lynnelen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 20-21st. We used their apartment which is several blocks away. It offered a mini fridge, stovetop and table. We had 5 people which it sleeps, but it is pretty tight quarters. Kitchen/living room(2 chairs) and bunk beds are all in one room with a separate bedroom that sleeps 2. Shower kept up with all 5 of us, didn't run out of hot water. Breakfast was average, free eggs would have been nice instead of charging for them. Marco at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Bisanzio
HotelInfo.Address: Calle della Pieta 3651, 30122 Venice, Italy
